Drawing on your technical expertise you will provide transmission line designs for tender and construction and provide expertise for safety in design and constructability reviews as well as liaising with sub-contractors.§ § §You will be working in a very flat structured company, in a team environment where everyone's opinion counts§ §You will be happy to set your own agenda and are comfortable working with ambiguity§ §Use your keen eye to be commercially savvy as well as forecasting workload accurately§ §Needs someone with a "can-do" attitude, thriving on solving problems others cannot§ §Suits someone that enjoys the detail§ § §Skills & experience§ § §Experience within OHL Transmission or Distribution Design (minimum 5 years)§ §PLS– CADD, Pole & Tower > Proficient User§ §Degree Qualified - Civil or Mechanical§ §Excellent Team Communication Skills§ §Familiarity with NZ, Australian & International design codes as well as standards for the Electricity Supply Industry.§ § §Benefits & culture§ The team and office culture are very much inclusive, there is office banter, our staff know how to work hard and play hard.§ § §We offer a flexible approach to working§ §Market rated salary§ §We have a fantastic environment for you to work and develop in as we believe in developing exceptional people§ §Ability to have face time with the client out of the office and go onto site to see your hard work in action§ § To apply for this coveted role §click the apply now button below§ If you have any questions regarding this role or want a confidential discussion about career opportunities please contact Daniel Gallen on +64 21 276 2657§§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in New Zealand?§§§

jobText: TXT/50591503.txt	§Asset Performance Engineer§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Asset Performance Engineer§§Advertiser: §Vector§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§18 Sept 2020§§Location§§Auckland§, §Auckland Central§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Mining, Resources & Energy§, §Power Generation & Distribution§§§§§§§§§  §    §    §      §Asset Performance Engineer §      §        §We're on a mission to reinvent the way homes, cities and communities are powered. Our people are creating a new energy future where power will flow through brilliant infrastructure, smart technology and clever systems. Our customers tell us they want safe, reliable and affordable energy systems that empower them with choice and control. Solar, next-gen batteries and other energy technologies will all play a part. We need the best and the brightest to capitalise on the convergence of technology, sustainability and customer focus that forms the basis of our strategy. We’ve done great things already, join us and help us do even more.§        §About the role§        §The purpose of this role is to understand the performance of the electricity network assets and, with the support of the wider team, determine the relevant asset strategies required to meet the stated objectives. This role is also the go-to subject matter expert providing specific engineering expertise to the business for the broad range of assets that make up a large distribution network.§        §The key responsibilities in this role are:§        §          §Monitor ongoing performance of the network and report against safety, quality, environment and reliability target§          §Determine optimal asset management strategies for each class of asset in order to meet the stated asset management objectives, working with the wider team to optimise the balance between ongoing maintenance and longer-term replacement§          §Support in development of maintenance strategies and compilation of associated reporting and engineering standards§          §Support the application of Vector's risk management process, including being a risk owner for certain assigned risks in the risk registers§          §Assess risk, consider appropriate mitigation options, ongoing management of controls and treatments§          §Provide specialist engineering expertise and technical support as needed for, the preparation of the Asset Management Plan for electricity, the management and support of Vectors Network Engineering Standards for Maintenance, Design and Asset Introduction, as well as to other team members within Vector and our Service Providers§          §Provide tactical support and direction to operational incident and associated response planning as required§          §Provide rapid and concise advice in response to network incidents and failure recovery activity§        §        §Who we are looking for§        §We are seeking someone who knows high/medium voltage electrical assets, and has an ability to analyse data and information to make informed decisions.§        §The key skills and experience you will need to be successful in this role are:§        §          §Graduate degree in Electrical Engineering or have a number of years of experience in the high/medium voltage electrical industry§          §Good understanding of electrical network assets including performance levels, maintenance and inspection practices§          §Demonstrates ability to interrogate systems such as SAP or GIS to obtain data, and then be able to analyse, interpret and identify trends within that spreadsheet based data in order to make informed decisions and recommendations§          §Strong critical thinking skills§          §Ability to lead tasks and operate independently§          §Ability to communicate effectively and work with multiple other teams across the business, often with diverse backgrounds, cultures, viewpoints and ways of thinking§          §Demonstrates a passion to make a difference§        §        §What we can offer you§        §We take pride in our vision and values, working together to create a new energy future. §        §You'll be joining a dynamic company that provides the ideal career environment for people with high calibre attitudes, experience and skills. You'll be offered a competitive salary, a range of great benefits, and the opportunity to grow and make a real difference in a supportive, high-performing team.§        §Vector engages a workforce made up of people and teams with diverse skills, values, backgrounds and experiences. We welcome applications from all individuals. Vector respects and values people who are different from each other, including gender, ethnicity, disability, age, sexual orientation, race and religion. We were the first corporate Living Wage Accredited employer, and the first Accessibility Tick employer. We are, of course, Rainbow Tick accredited, and Vector also won three gongs at the 2019 Diversity Awards NZ, including the Supreme Award. Why wouldn't you want to work here.§        §If you require special assistance or accessibility support from us during the application and selection process, please do not hesitate to email §recruitment@vector.co.nz§        §For standard applications, please ensure you apply via the Apply link as hiring managers are unable to view and assess applications via this email.§      §      §      §      §www.vector.co.nz§    §  §§§We're on a mission to reinvent the way homes, cities and communities are powered. Our people are creating a new energy future where power will flow through brilliant infrastructure, smart technology and clever systems. Our customers tell us they want safe, reliable and affordable energy systems that empower them with choice and control. Solar, next-gen batteries and other energy technologies will all play a part. We need the best and the brightest to capitalise on the convergence of technology, sustainability and customer focus that forms the basis of our strategy. We’ve done great things already, join us and help us do even more.§ §About the role§ §The purpose of this role is to understand the performance of the electricity network assets and, with the support of the wider team, determine the relevant asset strategies required to meet the stated objectives. This role is also the go-to subject matter expert providing specific engineering expertise to the business for the broad range of assets that make up a large distribution network.§ §The key for each class of asset in order to meet the stated asset management objectives, working with the wider team to optimise the balance between ongoing maintenance and longer-term replacement§ §Support in development of maintenance strategies and compilation of associated reporting and engineering standards§ §Support the application of Vector's risk management process, including being a risk owner for certain assigned risks in the risk registers§ §Assess risk, consider appropriate mitigation options, ongoing management of controls and treatments§ §Provide specialist engineering expertise and technical support as needed for, the preparation of the Asset Management Plan for electricity, the management and support of Vectors Network Engineering Standards for Maintenance, Design and Asset Introduction, as well as to other team members within Vector and our Service Providers§ §Provide tactical support and direction to operational incident and associated response planning as required§ §Provide rapid and concise advice in response to network incidents and failure recovery activity§ §Who we are looking for§ §We are seeking someone who knows high/medium voltage electrical assets, and has an ability to analyse data and information to make informed decisions.§ §The key skills and experience you will need to be successful in this role are:§ § §Graduate degree in Electrical Engineering or have a number of years of experience in the high/medium voltage electrical industry§ §Good understanding of electrical network assets including performance levels, maintenance and inspection practices§ §Demonstrates ability to interrogate systems such as SAP or GIS to obtain data, and then be able to analyse, interpret and identify trends within that spreadsheet based data in jobText: TXT/50596751.txt	§National Electrical Distribution Field Auditor§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§National Electrical Distribution Field Auditor§§Advertiser: §Network Compliance Ltd§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§20 Sept 2020§§Location§§Wellington§, §Hutt Valley§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Mining, Resources & Energy§, §Health, Safety & Environment§§§§§§Location: Preferably Wellington or Dunedin but may consider other regions.§ §Network Compliance Limited is an independent auditing company that provides field auditing services to a number of Electrical Distribution companies throughout New Zealand.§ §We are currently looking for an industry experienced person with a desire to advance their career with the preferred credentials: Senior Line Mechanic, Electrician, Technician or Electrical Fitter with Electrical Distribution network experience.§ §NCL has a strong industry focus and is seeking a unique individual who shares a passion for the electrical distribution industry, to ensure we continue to maintain high safety, quality, and environmental standards. The potential candidate must demonstrate strong personal values, and be committed to improving the health, safety, and culture of electrical distribution businesses through our developed audit processes and systems.§ §The position involves:§ § §National travel and staying away from your home base (week at a time)§ §Auditing field teams to ensure compliance with Health, Safety and Environmental legislative requirements, Industry Standards & Network Owner requirements.§ §Key client interface§ §Ability to provide executive reporting and convey audit outcomes to Company Leadership teams including Boards.§ §We are seeking a well-organised person with the following skills:§ § §A commitment for work place health, safety, and quality, with a desire to make a difference to the Electrical Distribution Industry.§ §Is passionate about people and can demonstrate an ability to lead and grow others.§ §Must have Electrical Distribution Field construction knowledge, particularly High & Low Voltage circuits but an appreciation or experience of Substations, Transformers and Live Line Glove & Barrier would also be advantageous.§ §Excellent communication and report writing skills; and § §IT literacy, particularly in Word/Excel.§ §Full training will be provided. Wellington and Dunedin are the preferred locations; however this is flexible depending on suitable candidate (must have close access to a national airport).§ §If you are self-motivated, able to work autonomously as well as part of a team, and possess strong customer communication skills, and want to make a difference within an excellent & progressive industry, we would like to hear from you. Please apply online with a current Curriculum Vitae.§ §All applications close, 11 October 2020, 5:00pm, unless a suitable candidate is identified prior to this date. Please note only those with existing NZ Residency or Working Rights will be considered.§§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in New Zealand?§Do you have a current New Zealand driver's licence?§Are you currently registered with the Electrical Workers Registration Board (EWRB)?§Do you have a current Police Check (Criminal Record Check) for employment?§Are you willing to undergo pre-employment drug and alcohol screening?§§§

EA Networks has a strong focus on people, culture and a commitment to leading edge technology.§If you would like to pursue the opportunity presented by this dynamic role, please submit your CV and Covering Letter in confidence.§§Please note§: Applicants for this role must be legally entitled to work in New Zealand.§For more information about the role and EA Networks,§please visit eanetworks.co.nz§§§§

It’s demanding, fun and exciting, where no two days are the same.§Our ideal person will be an excellent communicator, problem solver, have a knack for building relationships, a good eye for detail, analytical thinking and the ability to read and understand detailed reporting.  We work hard and go above and beyond to provide the very best customer service. We also have a lot of fun along the way!§Reporting to the Sales Manager your main responsibilities include:§  §First point of contact for branch counter sales and customer enquiries§  §Coordinating the branch stock reorder requirements, health and safety, finance/orders and general maintenance.§  §Stock management, picking and packing, loading and assisting with unloading of trucks and containers. §  §Supporting the sales team to provide the best service to our customers.§Our ideal person:§  §At least 2 years warehousing and logistics experience§Have a knack for understanding and interpreting data and reports to make sound decisions.§  §Excellent communication skills, customer service and the ability to build solid relationships.§  §A forklift license and MPI AP accreditation would be advantageous.§  §Attention to detail and know your way around a computer.§  §Physically fit and able to lift our products safely.§  §Confident working under pressure with a positive, can-do attitude.§  §Real team player that is happy to help to ensure the continued success of our growing branch.§If you believe you have what it takes then please apply today!§§§§Right to live and work§§You must have the§ right to live and work §in this location to apply for this job.§§§

jobText: TXT/50624688.txt	§Operator Maintainer§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Operator Maintainer§§Advertiser: §Chapman Employment Relations Ltd§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§24 Sept 2020§§Location§§Canterbury§, §Timaru & South Canterbury§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Mining, Resources & Energy§, §Natural Resources & Water§§§§§§Opuha Water Ltd is a progressive infrastructure and irrigation co-operative company based in South Canterbury looking for someone with the above attributes to join their team.§ §They have been part of their local community for over 20 years and have delivered significant environmental and community benefits over this time. Working with a very precious natural resource, fresh water, they take their obligations incredibly seriously around its management. As a small and dedicated team, they are all passionate about what they do and need someone who will fit right in and who will build a great rapport with their water users and key shareholders.§ §The successful applicant will not only be able to ensure that irrigated water is delivered on time to shareholders, they will play a key part in the ongoing maintenance of the associated irrigation scheme infrastructure, as well as assist in the maintenance management of the Opuha Dam and Power Station.§ §Previous experience in monitoring water flows and irrigation infrastructure maintenance and Power Station maintenance and management is required. A level of competency in basic electrical and mechanical maintenance. Basic hand tooling and work Ute is supplied for work duties.  Whilst Opuha Water have identified these areas as being preferred, they are above all else looking for a great attitude towards producing positive outcomes, a capacity to learn and develop and have a continuous improvement mindset.§ §This role participates in the Operations team’s on-call roster every third weekend on call so flexibility is a must.§ §If you love a challenge, then this could be the perfect role for you in a great work environment, in a great part of New Zealand with variety and plenty of scope for you to demonstrate your technical skills.§ §If this sounds like the role you’ve been looking for then we want to hear from you, click §'apply now'§ to forward your CV and cover letter.§ §For a copy of the job description please copy this link in your web browser https://www.chapmaner.co.nz/wp-content/uploads/sites/82/2020/09/OWL-Op_Maint-PD.pdf§ §Applications close: Monday 11 October 2020§§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in New Zealand?§What's your expected annual base salary?§§§

jobTitle: Reticulation Programme Engineer (Underground) Job in Canterbury - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50625456.txt	§Reticulation Programme Engineer (Underground)§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Reticulation Programme Engineer (Underground)§§Advertiser: §Orion NZ Ltd§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§24 Sept 2020§§Location§§Canterbury§, §Christchurch§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Mining, Resources & Energy§, §Power Generation & Distribution§§§§§§§§§  §    §    §      §Reticulation Programme Engineer (Underground) §      §        §The Role§        §Our electricity network spans between the Waimakariri and Rakaia rivers and stretches from Banks Peninsula to the foot of Arthur’s Pass.  Building, maintaining and operating this network in a safe and reliable way is vital to ensure our community receives a safe and resilient supply of energy into the future. §        §This role is responsible for the overall design, programme and scope of underground reticulation works from the network reticulation budgets, including management of third-party requests for reticulation works that involve the interface of Orion assets on private property.§        §The Candidate§        §To be successful in this role you will be a natural communicator with a customer centric approach. You will be solutions focused and able to work alongside a number of different stakeholders to achieve outcomes. You will also identify with Orion’s purpose and values and be able to contribute positively to the way we work.§        §You will also have:§        §          §At least 5 years’ experience with the construction and maintenance of overhead and underground power distribution systems§          §Experience in the Electricity Distribution industry and extensive knowledge of and experience in applying the Supply Regulations§          §Knowledge of the Resource Management Act§          §Level 6 NZ Diploma in Engineering or equivalent knowledge gained through practical experience§          §Analytical experience with financial data, inspection data and data visualisations, experience with PowerBI would be an advantage§        §        §About Orion§        §Orion plays a vital role in supplying electricity to our communities in Canterbury. We seek diversity of thought and encourage an inclusive and flexible working environment.  This, together with our adaptable approach positions us well for the future. We are committed to the health, safety and wellbeing of our people and we seek to engage, build strong relationships and work together to create the best outcomes. With a strong commitment to our community, we continually strive towards a sustainable future that can be shared by all.§      §      §To apply please visit the careers page on our website: www.oriongroup.co.nz and submit a cover letter along with your resume.§For further information please contact Jade on §03 363 9815§Closing date:  15 October 2020 §    §    §  §§§The Role§ §Our electricity network spans between the Waimakariri and Rakaia rivers and stretches from Banks Peninsula to the foot of Arthur’s Pass.  Building, maintaining and operating this network in a safe and reliable way is vital to ensure our community receives a safe and resilient supply of energy into the future. § §This role is responsible for the overall design, programme and scope of underground reticulation works from the network reticulation budgets, including management of third-party requests for reticulation works that involve the interface of Orion assets on private property.§ §The Candidate§ §To be successful in this role you will be a natural communicator with a customer centric approach. You will be solutions focused and able to work alongside a number of different stakeholders to achieve outcomes. You will also identify with Orion’s purpose and values and be able to contribute positively to the way we work.§ §You will also have:§ § §At least 5 years’ experience with the construction and maintenance of overhead and underground power distribution systems§ §Experience in the Electricity Distribution industry and extensive knowledge of and experience in applying the Supply Regulations§ §Knowledge of the Resource Management Act§ §Level 6 NZ Diploma in Engineering or equivalent knowledge gained through practical experience§ §Analytical experience with financial data, inspection data and data visualisations, experience with PowerBI would be an advantage§ §About Orion§ §Orion plays a vital role in supplying electricity to our communities in Canterbury. We seek diversity of thought and encourage an inclusive and flexible working environment.  This, together with our adaptable approach positions us well for the future. We are committed to the health, safety and wellbeing of our people and we seek to engage, build strong relationships and work together to create the best outcomes. With a strong commitment to our community, we continually strive towards a sustainable future that can be shared by all.§§§§

jobTitle: Tradesperson Mechanical Job in Southland - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50627149.txt	§Tradesperson Mechanical§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Tradesperson Mechanical§§Advertiser: §Rio Tinto§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§24 Sept 2020§§Location§§Southland§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Mining, Resources & Energy§, §Mining - Engineering & Maintenance§§§§§§Tradesperson Mechanical§ §About the role§ §Reporting to the Superintendent your role will focused on identifying opportunities to extend critical equipment component life and preventing early life equipment failure. With a demonstrated commitment to improving safety, cost and productivityyou will follow structured processes to optimise preventative maintenance tactics and minimise overall business costs. § §Working Monday to Friday 8am – 4pm, or with the flexibility for a 9-day fortnight work pattern, this is a role where you can really make a difference to maintenance outcomes.  § §About you§ §We are seeking a person with excellent communication skills that has a relevant mechanical trade qualification, preferably in Maintenance and Diagnostics, Fitting and Welding or in a comparable trade.§ §Experience diagnosing and repairing hydraulic systems is preferable and prior experience in heavy industry, large scale complex continuous processing operations beneficial.§ §We require successful candidates to possess a high degree of flexibility and strong problem-solving skills to identify and conduct planned and unplanned repair and diagnostic work within production time constraints on a wide variety of equipment.§ §Where you will be working§ §New Zealand Aluminium Smelters Limited (NZAS) is Rio Tinto’s only New Zealand site. We are pioneers in producing low carbon, high purity aluminium essential to human progress.§ §We pride ourselves on being a world leader in quality aluminium products, founded on our deep commitment to safety and operational excellence which we believe is created by the best people in the industry.§ §Our Benefits§ § § §·         Flexible working arrangements § §·         A competitive base salary reflective of your experience and annual incentive program§ §·         Immediate access to the Rio Tinto shares programme§ §·         Private health insurance contribution for all employees and immediate family members § §·         Career development & education assistance to further your ambitions § §·         Paid parental leave at 9 months (half pay) and 4.5 months full pay§ §We also offer exclusive employee discounts all over the world together with a wellness program for physical and mental wellbeing through fitness and activity allowances.§ §Where you will be working§ §You will be a part of the People Services team, the delivery team of our Human Resources function. It offers global expertise and services in areas of day-to-day HR operations. The role reports through to the HR Team Lead based in Brisbane within the APAC East Coast HR team. § §About us§ §As pioneers in mining and metals, we produce materials essential to human progress.§ §Iron ore to shape our city skylines. Aluminium for cars and smartphones. Copper for wind turbines, electric cars and the pipes that bring water to our home.  Borates that help crops grow, titanium for paint – and diamonds that celebrate the best things in life. § §Our long history is filled with firsts. We’ve developed some of the world’s largest and best quality mines and operations, and our people work in around 35 countries across six continents.§ §Creating an inclusive and diverse workforce§ §We particularly welcome and encourage applications from Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander people, LGBTI+ people, women, mature workers, people with disabilities and people from different cultural backgrounds. No matter how they may differ, our people share one thing in common. It’s a belief that work is more rewarding when we are accepted and valued for our differences, not judged by them. We all have something to contribute, and it’s this contribution that makes for a great organisation and fulfilling career. § §Apply today if you want to work with the latest technology and innovation, in an environment where we challenge you to drive positive change.§ § Please note, in order to be successfully considered for this role you must complete all pre-screening questions.§§§§

We’ve developed some of the world’s largest and best quality mines and operations, and our people work in around 35 countries across six continents.§ §Creating an inclusive and diverse workforce§ §We particularly welcome and encourage applications from Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander people, LGBTI+ people, women, mature workers, people with disabilities and people from different cultural backgrounds. No matter how they may differ, our people share one thing in common. It’s a belief that work is more rewarding when we are accepted and valued for our differences, not judged by them. We all have something to contribute, and it’s this contribution that makes for a great organisation and fulfilling career. § §Apply today if you want to work with the latest technology and innovation, in an environment where we challenge you to drive positive change.§ § Please note, in order to be successfully considered for this role you must complete all pre-screening questions.§§§§

jobText: TXT/50632697.txt	§Project Manager Support§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Project Manager Support§§Advertiser: §Powerco§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§25 Sept 2020§§Location§§Taranaki§, §New Plymouth§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Mining, Resources & Energy§, §Other§§§§§§§§§  §    §    §      §Project Manager Support §      §      §      §        §New Plymouth or Whanganui§        §We might be a little biased, but we reckon Powerco's Electricity Works Delivery team is a pretty special place to work. Completing large infrastructure upgrades? Check. Responding to major events? Check. Delivering multimillion-dollar projects? Check. We're all about working on the important things that make a big difference to our customers and communities. To do this, we need planners, thinkers, doers, systems gurus, people people, leaders and followers to work collaboratively and get the job done.§        §If you pass the team-fit test with flying colours, let's chat about the role. We are seeking an early career project manager who needs a change of scene in order to flourish. You'll have all the fundamentals in place - a strong knowledge base, a team player willing to pitch in your expertise, a natural flair for engaging people, and a track record of making things happen.§        §You'll have a knack for building relationships that deliver win-win outcomes. You'll be able to prioritise and say no when needed. You'll be solution-focused, empathetic, and take a balanced approach to decision making. Your comfort with digital ways of working and be able to quickly decipher technical issues and identify smarter ways of working. Of course, you'll pass the 'on the bus' test and work within Powerco's values, code of business conduct, policies and standards which collectively define the base-line behaviours required of us all.§        §If you have proven performance, plenty of potential and just need a break to pursue your passion for project management, let's talk.§        §Applications close Friday, 9 October 2020.§        §At Powerco, we are strong supporters of inclusion and diversity and believe that a diverse workplace adds to our ideas, solutions and overall strength. We foster a flexible working environment that is collaborative and trusted and is representative of the community which we serve. jobText: TXT/50632831.txt	§Mechanical Tradesperson§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Mechanical Tradesperson§§Advertiser: §Enerflex Australasia Holdings Pty Ltd§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§25 Sept 2020§§Location§§Taranaki§, §New Plymouth§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Mining, Resources & Energy§, §Oil & Gas - Engineering & Maintenance§§§§§§§§§  §    §    §      §Mechanical Tradesperson §      §        §Enerflex is a respected global player in the oil and gas industry with a significant footprint throughout Australasia and a history of rapid growth in our region. We are a major mechanical and electrical service provider for gas compression / power generation equipment in the energy and resources sectors.§The scope of the Mechanical Tradesperson role involves providing maintenance, repairs, overhaul, diagnostics and condition monitoring services on specialised equipment for clients in the Power Generation, Oil and Gas Industries.§The successful candidate will be a positive team player with:§        §          §Industry relevant trade qualification§          §Post apprenticeship experience working with Waukesha or Caterpillar gas-fueled engines§          §Previous experience working on reciprocating and / or rotary screw compression equipment§          §Experience overhauling large engines§          §Good communication and computer literacy skills (Word, Excel)§          §Self-motivation to achieve daily expectations§          §Demonstrated high regard for safety§          §Manual driver’s license  §        §        §The following will be highly regarded§        §          §OEM Caterpillar, Waukesha and / or Ariel Training§          §Current FA/CPR qualifications§          §Working at Heights, Confined Space and / or Hazardous Areas certification§        §        §Working Conditions§This position is based in New Plymouth, New Zealand and will typically work on-shore and off-shore in the Taranaki area Monday to Friday with additional weekend and rostered on-call activities being required. The applicant could also be eligible to mobilise internationally when work load requires it.§Enerflex is an Equal Opportunity Employer§Enerflex grants equal employment opportunity to all qualified persons without regard to race, color, sex, age, national origin, religion, genetic information, mental or physical disability, or any other characteristic protected by applicable federal, state, or local law.  Equal employment opportunities are provided in recruitment, hiring, promotions, wages, benefits, and other terms, conditions, and privileges of employment.§To complete your application, please respond to the screening questions sent to your nominated email address. Only completed applications will be considered.§ §For more information about Enerflex please visit our website or follow us on social media.§        §§      §      §      §    §    §Excelling with Energy. § Flourishing with Opportunity.§  §§§Enerflex is a respected global player in the oil and gas industry with a significant footprint throughout Australasia and a history of rapid growth in our region. We are a major mechanical and electrical service provider for gas compression / power generation equipment in the energy and resources sectors.§The scope of the Mechanical Tradesperson role involves providing maintenance, repairs, overhaul, diagnostics and condition monitoring services on specialised equipment for clients in the Power Generation, Oil and Gas Industries.§The successful candidate will be a positive team player with:§Industry relevant trade qualification§Post apprenticeship experience working with Waukesha or Caterpillar gas-fueled engines§Previous experience working on reciprocating and / or rotary screw compression equipment§Experience overhauling large engines§Good communication and computer literacy skills (Word, Excel)§Self-motivation to achieve daily expectations§Demonstrated high regard for safety§Manual driver’s license  §The following will be highly regarded§OEM Caterpillar, Waukesha and / or Ariel Training§Current FA/CPR qualifications§Working at Heights, Confined Space and / or Hazardous Areas certification§Working Conditions§This position is based in New Plymouth, New Zealand and will typically work on-shore and off-shore in the Taranaki area Monday to Friday with additional weekend and rostered on-call activities being required. The applicant could also be eligible to mobilise internationally when work load requires it.§Enerflex is an Equal Opportunity Employer§Enerflex grants equal employment opportunity to all qualified persons without regard to race, color, sex, age, national origin, religion, genetic information, mental or physical disability, or any other characteristic protected by applicable federal, state, or local law.  Equal employment opportunities are provided in recruitment, hiring, promotions, wages, benefits, and other terms, conditions, and privileges of employment.§To complete your application, please respond to the screening questions sent to your nominated email address. Only completed applications will be considered.§ §For more information about Enerflex please visit our website or follow us on social media.§§§§Right to live and work§§You must have the§ right to live and work §in this location to apply for this job.§§§

jobTitle: Project Manager Support Job in Wellington - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50632917.txt	§Project Manager Support§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Project Manager Support§§Advertiser: §Powerco§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§25 Sept 2020§§Location§§Wellington§, §Rest of Wellington Region§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Mining, Resources & Energy§, §Other§§§§§§§§§  §    §    §      §Project Manager Support §      §      §      §        §Palmerston North or Masterton§        §We might be a little biased, but we reckon Powerco's Electricity Works Delivery team is a pretty special place to work. Completing large infrastructure upgrades? Check. Responding to major events? Check. Delivering multimillion-dollar projects? Check. We're all about working on the important things that make a big difference to our customers and communities. To do this, we need planners, thinkers, doers, systems gurus, people people, leaders and followers to work collaboratively and get the job done.§        §If you pass the team-fit test with flying colours, let's chat about the role. We are seeking an early career project manager who needs a change of scene in order to flourish. You'll have all the fundamentals in place - a strong knowledge base, a team player willing to pitch in your expertise, a natural flair for engaging people, and a track record of making things happen.§        §You'll have a knack for building relationships that deliver win-win outcomes. You'll be able to prioritise and say no when needed. You'll be solution-focused, empathetic, and take a balanced approach to decision making. Your comfort with digital ways of working and be able to quickly decipher technical issues and identify smarter ways of working. Of course, you'll pass the 'on the bus' test and work within Powerco's values, code of business conduct, policies and standards which collectively define the base-line behaviours required of us all.§        §If you have proven performance, plenty of potential and just need a break to pursue your passion for project management, let's talk.§        §Applications close Friday, 9 October 2020.§        §At Powerco, we are strong supporters of inclusion and diversity and believe that a diverse workplace adds to our ideas, solutions and overall strength. We foster a flexible working environment that is collaborative and trusted and is representative of the community which we serve. We believe that individuals thrive, and the business prospers when people have a rewarding work experience and can be themselves.§        §Whiria te tangata - weave the people together.§        §§      §      §      §    §    §  §§§Palmerston North or Masterton§ §We might be a little biased, but we reckon Powerco's Electricity Works Delivery team is a pretty special place to work. Completing large infrastructure upgrades? Check. Responding to major events? Check. Delivering multimillion-dollar projects? Check. We're all about working on the important things that make a big difference to our customers and communities. To do this, we need planners, thinkers, doers, systems gurus, people people, leaders and followers to work collaboratively and get the job done.§ §If you pass the team-fit test with flying colours, let's chat about the role. We are seeking an early career project manager who needs a change of scene in order to flourish. You'll have all the fundamentals in place - a strong knowledge base, a team player willing to pitch in your expertise, a natural flair for engaging people, and a track record of making things happen.§ §You'll have a knack for building relationships that deliver win-win outcomes. You'll be able to prioritise and say no when needed. You'll be solution-focused, empathetic, and take a balanced approach to decision making. Your comfort with digital ways of working and be able to quickly decipher technical issues and identify smarter ways of working. Of course, you'll pass the 'on the bus' test and work within Powerco's values, code of business conduct, policies and standards which collectively define the base-line behaviours required of us all.§ §If you have proven performance, plenty of potential and just need a break to pursue your passion for project management, let's talk.§ §Applications close Friday, 9 October 2020.§ §At Powerco, we are strong supporters of inclusion and diversity and believe that a diverse workplace adds to our ideas, solutions and overall strength. We foster a flexible working environment that is collaborative and trusted and is representative of the community which we serve. We believe that individuals thrive, and the business prospers when people have a rewarding work experience and can be themselves.§ §Whiria te tangata - weave the people together.§§§§§

jobTitle: QAQC Engineer- Drilling & Completions Job in Taranaki - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50633576.txt	§QAQC Engineer- Drilling & Completions§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§QAQC Engineer- Drilling & Completions§§Advertiser: §Yakka Solutions§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§25 Sept 2020§§Location§§Taranaki§, §New Plymouth§§Salary§§$60 - $74.99 per hour§§Work Type§§Contract/Temp§§Classification§§Mining, Resources & Energy§, §Oil & Gas - Engineering & Maintenance§§§§§§ §About us§ §My Client are Leaders in Non-productive-time Solutions for the Oil and Gas Industry.Specialists in QA/QC, Accreditation and Standards, Engineering and Training§ § § §Qualifications & experience§ §Qualified QAQC Engineer §Drilling & Completions - Preventative Maintenance & Oil Tools exp. § § § §Tasks & responsibilities§ §Review of Quality documentation / Procedures / Specifications and to ensure that they are compliant to the required client specifications§Visit Machine Shop facilities to verify manufacturing or repairs are as per required specifications, §Verify that all lifting equipment and CCU supplied by the third party is in certification, and compliant with client Lifting Equipment requirements. §Verify and witness ITP/QCP/SOP for equipment used §Review and ensure that Drill String / OCTG items used on the well are compliant with relevant standards, DS-1®, NS-2™, NS- 1™, API (raw materials, manufacturing, machining, and threading) §Perform surveillance of inspection activities to relevant specifications : DS1, NS2™, API witness and monitor Cleaning, VTI, EMI, NDT, Dimensional, Traceability, Preservation and Reporting. §Verify build sheets and witness / monitor assembly of BHA, Testing, and Completion sub-assemblies. §Provide final/daily/NCR reports as reqd incl tracking of agreed remedial plans.§ § § §Benefits§ §Ongoing Assignments Available§Travel Locally & International§Great rates of Pay§Flexible rosters available§ §§§§

jobTitle: National Manager Compliance Job in Wellington - SEEK
advertiser: Ministry of Business, Innovation and Employment
jobText: TXT/50640448.txt	§National Manager Compliance§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§National Manager Compliance§§Advertiser: §Ministry of Business, Innovation and Employment§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§28 Sept 2020§§Location§§Wellington§, §Wellington Central§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Mining, Resources & Energy§, §Health, Safety & Environment§§§§§§§§§  §    §    §      §National Manager Compliance §      §        §          §Join the Energy and Resource Markets leadership team!§          §Lead compliance functions within the ERM portfolio to build the greatest value for NZ §          §Permanent role based in Wellington §        §        § §        §We have an opportunity to join our Energy & Resource Markets (ERM)leadership team as the National Manager Compliance. This is a senior leadership and national management position that reports to the General Manager of ERM within the Building, Resources and Markets group.§        §You will lead a team of professionals to educate, investigate and when appropriate, enforce the Crown Minerals Act requirements. Your team will ensure the petroleum and mineral sectors are complying with the rules and developing Crown resources responsibly.§        §We are seeking a person who brings a wealth of leadership experience, and with compliance management. You will work alongside your peers to ensure we are enabling our sectors and fulfilling our obligations and knowledge and experience within these sectors and the Crown Minerals Act will be an advantage. Relationship management will be an innate strength, and you will have experience working with stakeholders, across sectors, and with our Iwi and community groups.§        § §        §Skills and experience required:§        §          §Proven experience and strategic leadership of a compliance work programme§          §Experienced people leader with effective communication (written and verbal) and relationship skills§          §A strong commitment to Health and Safety§          §Passionate about continuous improvement and driving quality, culture throughout the business§          §A relevant tertiary qualification or relevant experience is essential for this role§          §You must be eligible to live and work in New Zealand§        §        § §        §Energy & Resource Markets §        §Our branch is responsible for leading the policy for New Zealand's energy and resource sector, and the government agency responsible for regulating the Crown Minerals Estate.§        § §        §How to apply:§        §Click on the APPLY button below in order to be directed to our on-line careers website to fill out an application form and upload a copy of your CV and cover letter. You will also view a copy of the position description here.  Email §Lapulou.Moale@mbie.govt.nz§ quoting ref MBIE/1484033 if you have any further questions.§        §Applications will close at 5pm on Sunday 11 October 2020 §        §#LI-MBIE§      §      §      §    §    §  §§§§Join the Energy and Resource Markets leadership team!§§Lead compliance functions within the ERM portfolio to build the greatest value for NZ §§Permanent role based in Wellington §§ §We have an opportunity to join our Energy & Resource Markets (ERM)leadership team as the National Manager Compliance. This is a senior leadership and national management position that reports to the General Manager of ERM within the Building, Resources and Markets group.§You will lead a team of professionals to educate, investigate and when appropriate, enforce the Crown Minerals Act requirements. Your team will ensure the petroleum and mineral sectors are complying with the rules and developing Crown resources responsibly.§We are seeking a person who brings a wealth of leadership experience, and with compliance management. You will work alongside your peers to ensure we are enabling our sectors and fulfilling our obligations and knowledge and experience within these sectors and the Crown Minerals Act will be an advantage. Relationship management will be an innate strength, and you will have experience working with stakeholders, across sectors, and with our Iwi and community groups.§ §Skills and experience required:§§Proven experience and strategic leadership of a compliance work programme§Experienced people leader with effective communication (written and verbal) and relationship skills§A strong commitment to Health and Safety§Passionate about continuous improvement and driving quality, culture throughout the business§A relevant tertiary qualification or relevant experience is essential for this role§You must be eligible to live and work in New Zealand§§ §Energy & Resource Markets §Our branch is responsible for leading the policy for New Zealand's energy and resource sector, and the government agency responsible for regulating the Crown Minerals Estate.§ §How to apply:§Click on the APPLY button below in order to be directed to our on-line careers website to fill out an application form and upload a copy of your CV and cover letter. You will also view a copy of the position description here.  Email §Lapulou.Moale@mbie.govt.nz§ quoting ref MBIE/1484033 if you have any further questions.§Applications will close at 5pm on Sunday 11 October 2020 §#LI-MBIE§§§§

jobTitle: Project Manager Job in Manawatu - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50641339.txt	§Project Manager§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Project Manager§§Advertiser: §RobLawMax Recruitment§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§28 Sept 2020§§Location§§Manawatu§, §Rest of Manawatu§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Mining, Resources & Energy§, §Power Generation & Distribution§§§§§§§§§  §    §      §        §Project Manager §      §      §        §          §            §RobLawMax has exclusively partnered with a large and well known Electricity Distribution company who own and operate a network of poles, conductors, cables and transformers that carry electricity from the National Grid to homes and businesses within our region. They are on the search for a Project Manager to join their busy team in their Fielding office. §            §The ideal candidate will have extensive experience across the NZ Electricity and Distribution / Transmission network with good communication and relationship building skills. You will have a methodical approach to managing multiple projects with a level of high proficiency in producing and managing PM documentation. §            §As the Project Manager you will be responsible for:§            §              §Being the first contact and customer liaison by responding to customer initiated enquiries for chargeable work§              §Preparation of designs and scopes§              §Work Scheduling & Project Management§              §Project Administration & team management §            §            §To be successful in this role you will need:§            §              §A minimum of five years in the electricity distribution or transmission industry§              §Obtained a relevant trade or engineering qualification in the sector§              §Exposure to a variety of different types of operational roles within the industry§              §Ability to manage a team of 3-4 field staff§            §            §In return you will be rewarded with a competitive package which includes a bonus, 10 days sick leave and a vehicle as well as working for a stable company with a great track record. §            § §            §For more details on this role please contact Juanel on §04 471 6985§ or send your CV to : §jobs@roblawmax.co.nz§ quoting JV69888 as the reference number.§          §          §          §        §      §    §  §§§RobLawMax has exclusively partnered with a large and well known Electricity Distribution company who own and operate a network of poles, conductors, cables and transformers that carry electricity from the National Grid to homes and businesses within our region. They are on the search for a Project Manager to join their busy team in their Fielding office. § §The ideal candidate will have extensive experience across the NZ Electricity and Distribution / Transmission network with good communication and relationship building skills. You will have a methodical approach to managing multiple projects with a level of high proficiency in producing and managing PM documentation. § §As the Project Manager you will be responsible for:§ § §Being the first contact and customer liaison by responding to customer initiated enquiries for chargeable work§ §Preparation of designs and scopes§ §Work Scheduling & Project Management§ §Project Administration & team management § §To be successful in this role you will need:§ § §A minimum of five years in the electricity distribution or transmission industry§ §Obtained a relevant trade or engineering qualification in the sector§ §Exposure to a variety of different types of operational roles within the industry§ §Ability to manage a team of 3-4 field staff§ §In return you will be rewarded with a competitive package which includes a bonus, 10 days sick leave and a vehicle as well as working for a stable company with a great track record. § § § §For more details on this role please contact Juanel on §04 471 6985§ or send your CV to : §jobs@roblawmax.co.nz§ quoting JV69888 as the reference number.§§§§

jobTitle: Zero Harm Advisor Job in Wellington - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50641603.txt	§Zero Harm Advisor§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Zero Harm Advisor§§Advertiser: §DOWNER NZ§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§28 Sept 2020§§Location§§Wellington§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Mining, Resources & Energy§, §Health, Safety & Environment§§§§§§§§§  §    §    §      §Zero Harm Advisor §      §        §Downer New Zealand is a leading provider of integrated services.  Our commitment to building long term relationships and supporting our customers with high calibre services and solutions; the talents of our people; and consistent excellence in operational delivery sets us apart.§        §Join our team at the forefront of Zero Harm management in NZ. Downer is making bold moves to embed Zero Harm Operational Excellence and is implementing the right organisation-wide strategy to truly set up our people and our clients to succeed in achieving industry-leading Zero Harm performance.§        §A Bit about your role:§        §Our Zero Harm team's core purpose is to transfer Zero Harm knowledge to our operations people and support their capability to confidently make good decisions around Zero Harm that enhance the performance of their teams. They are trainers, coaches, mentors, and technical experts and work within a large diverse business that is complex and ever-changing.§        §A Bit about you:§        §You will be a committed Zero Harm Professional and will bring with you:§        §          §Experience within complex technical environments that are subject to ongoing change§          §Proven track record in assessing workplace sites, identifying risks, working with injuries and injury prevention.§          §The ability to work operationally alongside the business to drive a safety culture through the sites§          §Excellent written and verbal communication skills§          §The ability to engage and influence all levels of the business.§          §Experience within a Utilities environment (Power, Gas, Water, Telecommunications) would be an advantage but is not essential. §        §        §A role with Downer can enable you to develop and enhance your skills and experience.  This is a great opportunity for you to join our diverse and inclusive culture and be part of a great team thriving in a collaborative fast-paced environment.  We will reward you with a competitive remuneration package, flexible working arrangements, great training and ongoing development, and the opportunity to advance your career within our organisation. §        §If this sounds like the opportunity for you, head to www.downercareers.co.nz and enter reference number 571856 to apply. §        §Downer NZ is an equal opportunity employer committed to creating a diverse and inclusive culture.  §        §Our workplaces are drug and alcohol free - all successful applicants will be required to undertake a pre-employment drug test and medical. §      §      §      §    §    §www.downer.co.nz§  §§§Downer New Zealand is a leading provider of integrated services.  Our commitment to building long term relationships and supporting our customers with high calibre services and solutions; the talents of our people; and consistent excellence in operational delivery sets us apart.§Join our team at the forefront of Zero Harm management in NZ. Downer is making bold moves to embed Zero Harm Operational Excellence and is implementing the right organisation-wide strategy to truly set up our people and our clients to succeed in achieving industry-leading Zero Harm performance.§A Bit about your role:§Our Zero Harm team's core purpose is to transfer Zero Harm knowledge to our operations people and support their capability to confidently make good decisions around Zero Harm that enhance the performance of their teams. They are trainers, coaches, mentors, and technical experts and work within a large diverse business that is complex and ever-changing.§A Bit about you:§You will be a committed Zero Harm Professional and will bring with you:§§Experience within complex technical environments that are subject to ongoing change§Proven track record in assessing workplace sites, identifying risks, working with injuries and injury prevention.§The ability to work operationally alongside the business to drive a safety culture through the sites§Excellent written and verbal communication skills§The ability to engage and influence all levels of the business.§Experience within a Utilities environment (Power, Gas, Water, Telecommunications) would be an advantage but is not essential. §§A role with Downer can enable you to develop and enhance your skills and experience.  This is a great opportunity for you to join our diverse and inclusive culture and be part of a great team thriving in a collaborative fast-paced environment.  We will reward you with a competitive remuneration package, flexible working arrangements, great training and ongoing development, and the opportunity to advance your career within our organisation. §If this sounds like the opportunity for you, head to www.downercareers.co.nz and enter reference number 571856 to apply. §Downer NZ is an equal opportunity employer committed to creating a diverse and inclusive culture.  §Our workplaces are drug and alcohol free - all successful applicants will be required to undertake a pre-employment drug test and medical. §§§§

jobTitle: Technical and Operations Manager Job in Canterbury - SEEK
xenophobe: Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in New Zealand?
jobText: TXT/50641863.txt	§Technical and Operations Manager§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Technical and Operations Manager§§Advertiser: §QPower Ltd§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§28 Sept 2020§§Location§§Canterbury§, §Christchurch§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Mining, Resources & Energy§, §Power Generation & Distribution§§§§§§Full time position for a Technical and Operations Manager at our Christchurch Branch.§  §QPower is the South Island’s leading electricity generation solution provider and prides itself on providing efficient, flexible and economical solutions for its customers no matter how big or small the job is. This unique role involves managing the operational and technical requirements at our Christchurch branch and delivering for our customers. §  §Our customers rely on QPower for generator hire solutions, generator sales, product support and technical advice, and to have their own generator fleets maintained by specialised generation experts.§  §The Christchurch branch is relocating to a new flagship operation in Harewood early next year so this is a particularly exciting and opportunistic time to join as the operational leader of our Christchurch team. §  §For further information on QPower please visit our website: www.qpower.co.nz§  §The role requires:§ § §Managing the technical and operational requirements at our Christchurch Branch§ §Organising and delivering on the day to day logistics at the branch§ §Responding to customer enquiries, scoping and personally delivering on projects§ §Providing our customers with excellent technical support and advice on our modern and industry leading generation solutions§ §Providing our customers and QPower staff with a high level of safety and service§ §Leadership abilities and taking responsibility for branch operations and performance§ §This role will ideally be suited to a candidate that wants to forge a career path within a challenging yet rewarding industry.§ §You will need:§ § §Electrical qualifications - candidates with electrical qualifications and experience are strongly preferred§ §To have a passion for modern generation systems and providing Christchurch and the upper South Island with industry leading products and service§ §Mechanical experience would be advantageous to the role along with a keen interest to expand on this experience.§ §A willingness to travel for periods of time to sites around the country§ §To work flexible hours including attending after hours calls from time to time§ §Previous generator and controller experience will be beneficial§ §To be proficient in the user of computers, email, CRM and job and inventory management software. Training for our internal systems will be provided.§ §To have NZ residency or a valid NZ work visa§ §A full New Zealand drivers’ licence§ §A “hands on, can do” attitude§ §A competitive salary, vehicle, phone and great working environment will be provided.§§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in New Zealand?§Do you have a current New Zealand driver's licence?§§§

jobTitle: Trading Manager Job in Auckland - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50642200.txt	§Trading Manager§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Trading Manager§§Advertiser: §Genesis§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§28 Sept 2020§§Location§§Auckland§, §Auckland Central§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Mining, Resources & Energy§, §Management§§§§§§Genesis is New Zealand's largest energy retailer, supplying electricity, natural gas, and LPG, whilst generating around 20% of New Zealand's electricity, across our portfolio of thermal and renewable generation assets across the country. The spread of locations and fuel types in the portfolio gives us significant operating flexibility and our power stations are valuable assets for Genesis. In addition, our Trading team is a fascinating and complex part of our business, tasked with managing our electricity portfolio and carbon obligations.§About the role:§Our Spot Trading team, based across Auckland and Hamilton, work 24/7 to maximise the wholesale portfolio gross margin and manage risk in the short-term electricity and gas markets, whilst ensuring the consistent implementation of a long-term portfolio strategy. We are now on the look-out for a pragmatic leader to join us as the Spot Trading Manager to lead the team through a period of positive change while driving value and commercial outcomes.§This role can be based from either our Auckland or Hamilton offices, with the expectation that there will be weekly travel to maintain face-to-face interaction and development with your team.§Key Responsibilities:§Lead a team of motivated Spot Traders to cover the 24/7 trading desk.§Develop and deploy strategies to maximise both short and long-term returns from Genesis Energy's suite of generation assets in the wholesale spot market within acceptable risk guidelines.§Develop offer guidelines that govern the day to day trading activities of spot traders.§Actively manage near real time fuel use, outage planning, and operational activities that may affect the real time scheduling of plant.§Ensure market trading activities and process robustness to achieve compliance with market rules and environmental constraints.§Create a culture with a strong focus on quality to address any trade quality and consistency issues.§Trade on the desk as 'last person standing' should the need arise.§Monitor, support, and help with trader training and development to ensure knowledge and consistency within the trading team.§Establish and maintain an environment where the team and individuals are engaged, feel valued and strive for continuous improvement.§About you:§5+ years' trading experience, ideally within a physical energy market or similar.§3+ years' experience leading a team of shift workers.§Strong background in leading behavioural and culture change.§Demonstrated ability to analyse and interpret complex problems and use critical thinking in developing a range of options/solutions.§Knowledge and understanding of the energy industry regulatory environment and rules.§Experience within power generation will be highly regarded.§Mentoring skills around internal and external stakeholder management, communication, and collaboration will be critical to ensure that the team continues to add value.§This is a critical leadership role within Wholesale Markets. Your sound judgement, ability to influence, and experience in fostering a culture of adaptability, openness, and continuous learning and development will go hand-in-hand with your background in trading, with the ease to make discretionary decisions in a fast-paced real time environment.§This is a cross-function role, which will see you working with a multitude of business units within Trading, Operations, Finance, and the wider business. You will be a confident communicator and savvy collaborator, who can easily build rapport and relay information appropriately. You will be able to mitigate risk, ensure that appropriate business decisions are made, and be able to work with the details, whilst also having a view of the "big picture".§Our culture:§Excitingly, Genesis and the wider industry is changing at pace; as such it is essential that you enjoy working in a dynamic and agile environment where you are expected to push yourself, continually learn and develop, and take advantage of technology and digital solutions. Genesis is proud to be an inclusive workplace. We celebrate difference, diversity and aim to empower our employees. We reward our staff with a competitive salary, 4% KiwiSaver, a power discount, a collaborative culture and ongoing development opportunities. If this sounds like you, please apply online.§Please note, we are relocating to Wynyard Quarter in October.§§§§Right to live and work§§You must have the§ right to live and work §in this location to apply for this job.§§§

jobText: TXT/50647995.txt	§Metering Operations Manager§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Metering Operations Manager§§Advertiser: §Vector§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§29 Sept 2020§§Location§§Wellington§, §Wellington Central§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Mining, Resources & Energy§, §Management§§§§§§§§§  §    §    §      §Metering Operations Manager §      §        §About us §        §We're on a mission. We're changing the way we engage and use power through our innovation, and our customers throughout New Zealand and Australia are seeing the benefits of Advanced Smart Metering Services (AMS), and how it's helping them to manage their gas and electricity.§        §Vector's vision is to 'Create a new energy future' and the rollout of smart meters and smart metering services is a key part of this. Smart meters underpin the new energy future, by providing granular and real-time information about customer behaviour and energy usage, empowering new and innovative retail products, and enabling consumer participation in energy markets.§        §AMS combines large-scale field deployment and operations, with a cutting-edge data business focused on 'near real-time' delivery of big data and analytics to support the efficient functioning of the overall electricity markets in New Zealand and Australia§        §About the role§        §As a key part of the Metering senior leadership team, with Six Sigma methodology§        §        §About you§        §The successful candidate will need to demonstrate the following:§        §          §Strategic and commercial acumen§          §Ideally six or more years' experience in working in large utility and /or metering sector§          §Exposure to the leadership of high volume, large scale operation metering or similar§          §Previous experience leading organisational strategy and change§          §Proven relationship and influencing skills across a variety of stakeholders§          §A collaborative leadership mindset with an ability to lead and inspire and empower a team§          §Previous track record of implementing new business services into a business environment§        §        §What we can offer you§        §Vector engages a workforce made up of people and teams with diverse skills, values, backgrounds and experiences. Vector respects and values people who are different from each other, including gender, ethnicity, disability, age, sexual orientation, race and religion. We were the first corporate Living Wage Accredited employer, and the first Accessibility Tick employer. We are, of course, Rainbow Tick accredited, and Vector also won three gongs at the 2019 Diversity Awards NZ, including the Supreme Award. Smart meters underpin the new energy future, by providing granular and real-time information about customer behaviour and energy usage, empowering new and innovative retail products, and enabling consumer participation in energy markets.§ §AMS combines large-scale field deployment and operations, with a cutting-edge data business focused on 'near real-time' delivery of big data and analytics to support the efficient functioning of the overall electricity markets in New Zealand and Australia§ §About the role§ §As a key part of the Metering senior leadership team, this role will be responsible for leading field operations for the New Zealand mass market metering, Commercial and Industrial Gas and Vircom business units.§ §The role will be responsible for Vector's full lifecycle operations covering deployment and workflow, health and safety, quality, Field Service Provider (FSP) management and supply chain.§ §Other key areas of responsibility are as follows:§ § §Leading and inspiring staff with a vision that embodies Vector's values§ §Development of a fit for purpose customer management framework and ensure that all key customer relationships are managed within the framework§ §Managing FSP's to optimize end user customer outcomes and experience§ §Management of deployment projects including ensuring resources, costs and timeframes meet the business objectives§ §Managing Vircom field resources to ensure all operations are performed to strict HSE and quality parameters§ §Ensuring compliance to all relevant requirements and codes, while building relationships with Regulatory bodies§ §Driving continuous improvement initiatives and process efficiencies in line with Six Sigma methodology§ §About you§ §The successful candidate will need to demonstrate the
