jobTitle: Generation Controller - Trainee Job in Waikato - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50648811.txt	§Generation Controller - Trainee§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Generation Controller - Trainee§§Advertiser: §Contact Energy§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§29 Sept 2020§§Location§§Waikato§, §Taupo§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Mining, Resources & Energy§, §Power Generation & Distribution§§§§§§§§§  §    §    §      §Generation Controller - Trainee §      §        §Leading the way §        § §        §Our world has changed. It will never be the same again. Infact its almost a distant memory for most of us to remember what life was like ‘pre-covid’. There have been challenges for many of us and here at Contact Energy we are privileged to provide an essential service for all kiwis. We feel humbled to have played our part in keeping the lights on and the broadband pumping for over half a million customers.   §        § §        §Here at Contact we are deeply passionate about challenging the status quo. This shows up in many ways, one of which is to create a workplace that promotes personal and professional development, that’s why we are on a mission to find a Generation Controller to join our ‘best in class’ group of operators. Whether you are an experienced plant operator, or you have an interest in taking on a trainee role to learn a new craft - we want to talk to you. Keen to learn more, read on! §        § §        §Tell me more §        § §        §The primary focus of this role is to operate our Wairakei plant in a safe, efficient and timely manner within operational guidelines, EGR/NZEM rules, and offer guidelines to meet output and performance requirements. Safety is your middle name and keeping your peers in line with occupational health principles and practices will bring you great satisfaction.  §        §No day is likely to be the same as the last as you learn the specific code of compliance requirements for our Geothermal plants but here’s a small preview into some of tasks that will fill up your day; §        §          §            §Operate local and remote control power stations via DCS systems and respond to alarms / events. §          §          §            §Monitor plant performance, maintain plant efficiency, whilst identifying and anticipating events to prevent failures.  §          §        §        §          §            §Ensure that all activities and tasks are conducted in compliance with environmental consents and within station and company environmental guidelines and procedures §          §          §            §Contribute to the performance of the team by assisting in other areas or sites as required, including identifying opportunities for improvement of systems and processes, and suggest advice and/or strategies to other staff to minimise risk. §          §        §        §You may even have a couple of these gems: §        §          §            §Come from a trade background §          §          §            §Specialist qualification such as EnChem 3 or 4, 1st Class Stationary, 3rd Marine or equivalent §          §        §        §If not that is ok, as Contact Energy will provide full training up to, and including specialist qualifications like EnChem4 (and beyond) for the successful applicant. §        § §        §Who are you? §        § §        §We have a set of behaviours that we think describe the person we are looking for and the experience or attitude you will bring.  §        §          §            §Curiosity – you are often described as the person at the BBQ that asks, “but why”. This curiosity helps foster your innovative approach to your work and your overall team. §          §          §            §Human Kindness – you are a naturally inclusive person that thrives when collaborating with others, you take pride in what you do and how you treat others. §          §          §            §Pointed Focus – you focus on the important stuff and don’t stress on the small things §          §          §            §Progressive – matched with your curiosity you are always thinking about ‘how we can make things better’ and you are one of few people that feels comfortable being uncomfortable. We all know that’s the space where we learn the most!  §          §        §        § §        §The successful applicant will be rewarded with an attractive salary package and numerous benefits including discounted health care, our health and wellbeing program, discounted energy and the option to purchase extra annual leave among other benefits. §        §We run a 24/7 business, so this role will move into shift work once all training is completed, although day work roles may also be available from time to time.   §        §At Contact Energy, we are committed to creating a safe and inclusive environment which values and respects diverse styles, backgrounds, experiences and perspectives. §        §We welcome and encourage women, Tangata whenua and people from diverse backgrounds to apply. §        §Our teams are busy as we move into the colder months of the year, which means we want to fill this role quickly. If you have read this and it struck a chord, don’t delay. Apply now!  §        § §        §Please hit the apply now button to submit your application. If you have any questions, please contact us on §talent.acquisition@contactenergy.co.nz§        §§      §      §      §    §    §contact.co.nz§  §§§Leading the way § § § §Our world has changed. It will never be the same again. Infact its almost a distant memory for most of us to remember what life was like ‘pre-covid’. There have been challenges for many of us and here at Contact Energy we are privileged to provide an essential service for all kiwis. We feel humbled to have played our part in keeping the lights on and the broadband pumping for over half a million customers.   § § § §Here at Contact we are deeply passionate about challenging the status quo. This shows up in many ways, one of which is to create a workplace that promotes personal and professional development, that’s why we are on a mission to find a Generation Controller to join our ‘best in class’ group of operators. Whether you are an experienced plant operator, or you have an interest in taking on a trainee role to learn a new craft - we want to talk to you. Keen to learn more, read on! § § § §Tell me more § § § §The primary focus of this role is to operate our Wairakei plant in a safe, efficient and timely manner within operational guidelines, EGR/NZEM rules, and offer guidelines to meet output and performance requirements. Safety is your middle name and keeping your peers in line with occupational health principles and practices will bring you great satisfaction.  § §No day is likely to be the same as the last as you learn the specific code of compliance requirements for our Geothermal plants but here’s a small preview into some of tasks that will fill up your day; § § § §Operate local and remote control power stations via DCS systems and respond to alarms / events. § § § §Monitor plant performance, maintain plant efficiency, whilst identifying and anticipating events to prevent failures.  § § § §Ensure that all activities and tasks are conducted in compliance with environmental consents and within station and company environmental guidelines and procedures § § § §Contribute to the performance of the team by assisting in other areas or sites as required, including identifying opportunities for improvement of systems and processes, and suggest advice and/or strategies to other staff to minimise risk. § § §You may even have a couple of these gems: § § § §Come from a trade background § § § §Specialist qualification such as EnChem 3 or 4, 1st Class Stationary, 3rd Marine or equivalent § § §If not that is ok, as Contact Energy will provide full training up to, and including specialist qualifications like EnChem4 (and beyond) for the successful applicant. § § § §Who are you? § § § §We have a set of behaviours that we think describe the person we are looking for and the experience or attitude you will bring.  § § § §Curiosity – you are often described as the person at the BBQ that asks, “but why”. This curiosity helps foster your innovative approach to your work and your overall team. § § § §Human Kindness – you are a naturally inclusive person that thrives when collaborating with others, you take pride in what you do and how you treat others. § § § §Pointed Focus – you focus on the important stuff and don’t stress on the small things § § § §Progressive – matched with your curiosity you are always thinking about ‘how we can make things better’ and you are one of few people that feels comfortable being uncomfortable. We all know that’s the space where we learn the most!  § § § § §The successful applicant will be rewarded with an attractive salary package and numerous benefits including discounted health care, our health and wellbeing program, discounted energy and the option to purchase extra annual leave among other benefits. § §We run a 24/7 business, so this role will move into shift work once all training is completed, although day work roles may also be available from time to time.   § §At Contact Energy, we are committed to creating a safe and inclusive environment which values and respects diverse styles, backgrounds, experiences and perspectives. § §We welcome and encourage women, Tangata whenua and people from diverse backgrounds to apply. § §Our teams are busy as we move into the colder months of the year, which means we want to fill this role quickly. If you have read this and it struck a chord, don’t delay. Apply now!  § § § §Please hit the apply now button to submit your application. If you have any questions, please contact us on §talent.acquisition@contactenergy.co.nz§§§§§Right to live and work§§You must have the§ right to live and work §in this location to apply for this job.§§§

jobTitle: Kaiwhakahaere Whakahikonga - Pia Job in Waikato - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50648859.txt	§Kaiwhakahaere Whakahikonga - Pia§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Kaiwhakahaere Whakahikonga - Pia§§Advertiser: §Contact Energy§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§29 Sept 2020§§Location§§Waikato§, §Taupo§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Mining, Resources & Energy§, §Power Generation & Distribution§§§§§§§§§  §    §    §      §Kaiwhakahaere Whakahikonga - Pia §      §        §Te para i te huarahi§        §Kua huri te ao. E kore a muri e hokia. Me uaua pea ka maumahara ētahi o tātou ki te ao ‘o mua i te mate kowheori‘. Inā te huhua o nga wero kua tūponohia e tātou, ā, nō mātou o Contact Energy te māngari ki te whakahaere i tētahi umanga waiwai mō ngā tāngata maha o Aotearoa. E ngākau whakaiti ana i ngā mahi kua tutuki i a mātou, e kā tonu ai ngā rama, e hono tonu atu ai hoki te neke atu i te hāwhe miriona kiritaki ki te ipurangi.§        §E ngākaunui ana mātou o Contact ki te whakawhanake i ngā mahi kua roa e mahia ana. He nui tonu ngā tauira, ko tētahi, ko te whakaū i tētahi wāhi mahi e whakatairanga ana i te whakawhanaketanga matawhaiaro, ā-mahi hoki, ā, koinā e whai nei mātou i tētahi Kaiwhakahaere Whakahikonga hei mema mō ‘ngā tino o te mahi’, arā, mō te kāhui kaiwhakahaere. Ahakoa mātanga whakahaere whare hiko mai, tangata pīkoko noa mai rānei, e pīrangi ana ki te ako i ētahi pūkenga hou hei pia (me te aro hoki kia whanake ō pūkenga i ētahi mahi ngaio) - kei te hia kōrero tahi mātou ki a koe! Kua whiwhita rānei tō ngākau, me pānui tonu!§        § §        §He korero anō māu§        §Mā te tangata ka riro i a ia tēnei tūranga e whakahaere te wharehiko o Wairakei, i runga i te whai kia haumaru, kia pai, kia tika hoki te rere o ngā mahi, kia ū ki ngā aratohu whakahaere, ki ngā ture EGR/NZEM, me te whakatakoto aratohu hoki hei whakatutuki i ngā whāinga ka puta me ngā whāinga ā-mahi. Ko Haumarutanga tō ingoa tuarua, waihoki, ka tino koa tō ngākau i te arataki i ō hoa mahi kia ū ki ngā mātāpono me ngā whakahaere o te noho haumaru i tēnei whare.§        §Kāore tētahi rangi e tino rite ki te rangi o mua mai, nā te mea e ako ana koe i ngā tikanga tūtohu matua e tohitū ana ki te wharehiko ngāwhā o Wairakei, heoi anō, anei ētahi o ngā mahi hei whakatutuki māu;§        §          §He whakahaere wharehiko ā-rohe, ā-whakahaere mamao hoki, mā ngā pūnaha DCS, he whakautu hoki i ngā pūohotanga / take.§          §He aroturuki i ngā mahinga o te whare, he whakaū tonu i ngā mahinga tika, he kite wawe i ngā mahi mūhore i mua i te pupūnga ake o tētahi raru.§          §He whai kia hāngai ngā kaupapa me ngā mahi ki ngā whakaaetanga ā-taiao, ki ngā aratohu me ngā tikanga ā-taiao o te kamupene.§          §He āwhina hoki ki ētahi atu wāhi, whare rānei, i ngā wā e pīrangitia ana, mā te tūtohu āheinga hei whakawhanake i ngā pūnaha me ngā tukanga, mā te tuari i ētahi whakaaro taunaki, rautaki hoki/rānei ki ētahi atu kaimahi, kia iti iho ai te tūpono atu ki ngā tūraruraru.§        §        § §        §Ka pai hoki me he kei a koe ētahi o ēnei kura:§        §          §I ahu mai koe i tētahi ao mahi ā-rehe§          §Kua whāia tētahi tohu EnChem 3, 4 rānei, te 1st Class Stationary, te 3rd Marine, tētahi e hāngai ana rānei§        §        § §        §Ko wai koe?§        §Ki ō mātou whakaaro, koinei ngā whanonga ka puta i te tangata e whāia ana e mātou, ngā wheako, te waiaro hoki rānei ka whakatinanahia e koe.§        § §        §          §He Ngākau Pākiki – §ko koe tonu rā tēnā ka whiu i te pātai, “he aha ai”, i tētahi horanga kai hūhunu. Koinei te ngākau pākiki e ārahi nei i te āhua o āu mahi, o tō tīma anō hoki.§          §He Whakaaro Nui Ki Te Tangata – §he tangata whakaaro nui koe, ā, ka ora tō ngākau i te mahi tahi ki ētahi atu, he mea nui hoki ō mahi me te āhua o tō tiaki i ētahi atu ki a koe.§          §He Kanohi Arotahi – §ka arotahi koe ki ngā kaupapa whai take, kaua ki ngā kaupapa take kore.§          §He Kaikōkiri – §ka haere ngātahi tēnei me tō ngākau pākiki, nā te mea he rite tonu tō whakaaro ‘me pēhea e pai ake ai’, ko koe tētahi o te tokoiti e tau ana te noho i ngā wā o te uaua. Koia hoki rā te wā papai e ako ai te tangata!§        §        § §        §Ka rere ngā mahi o tēnei pākihi i te ao, i te pō, nō reira, ka huri hei mahi tīpakopako kia mutu ngā whakangungu katoa§        §Ko tā Contact Energy, he whai kia haumaru, kia ngākau tapatahi hoki te āhua o te mahi, kia nui ngā whakaaro, kia kaha hoki te whakaute i ngā taera, ngā ao, ngā wheako me ngā whakaaro kanorau hoki o ētahi atu.§        §Anei, e toro nei i te ringa, e āki nei hoki i te wahine, i te tangata whenua, i te hunga i ahu mai i ētahi ao anō, kia whakakīa te puka whakauru.§        §Ka nui ake ngā mahi mā te tīma nō tātou ka whakatata atu ki ngā kaupeka makariri o te tau, nō reira, kei te hiahia kia wawe tā mātou whai i tētahi mō tēnei tūranga. Mehemea kua pānuitia tēnei e koe, ā, kua tāwheta i a mātou tō ngākau, kaua e whakaroaroa. Tono mai!§        § §        §More details:§        §Application is very easy, hit the apply now to submit your CV. If you have any questions, please email the team on §talent.acquisition@contactenergy.co.nz§ §        §§      §      §      §    §    §contact.co.nz§  §§§Te para i te huarahi§ §Kua huri te ao. E kore a muri e hokia. Me uaua pea ka maumahara ētahi o tātou ki te ao ‘o mua i te mate kowheori‘. Inā te huhua o nga wero kua tūponohia e tātou, ā, nō mātou o Contact Energy te māngari ki te whakahaere i tētahi umanga waiwai mō ngā tāngata maha o Aotearoa. E ngākau whakaiti ana i ngā mahi kua tutuki i a mātou, e kā tonu ai ngā rama, e hono tonu atu ai hoki te neke atu i te hāwhe miriona kiritaki ki te ipurangi.§ §E ngākaunui ana mātou o Contact ki te whakawhanake i ngā mahi kua roa e mahia ana. He nui tonu ngā tauira, ko tētahi, ko te whakaū i tētahi wāhi mahi e whakatairanga ana i te whakawhanaketanga matawhaiaro, ā-mahi hoki, ā, koinā e whai nei mātou i tētahi Kaiwhakahaere Whakahikonga hei mema mō ‘ngā tino o te mahi’, arā, mō te kāhui kaiwhakahaere. Ahakoa mātanga whakahaere whare hiko mai, tangata pīkoko noa mai rānei, e pīrangi ana ki te ako i ētahi pūkenga hou hei pia (me te aro hoki kia whanake ō pūkenga i ētahi mahi ngaio) - kei te hia kōrero tahi mātou ki a koe! Kua whiwhita rānei tō ngākau, me pānui tonu!§ § § §He korero anō māu§ §Mā te tangata ka riro i a ia tēnei tūranga e whakahaere te wharehiko o Wairakei, i runga i te whai kia haumaru, kia pai, kia tika hoki te rere o ngā mahi, kia ū ki ngā aratohu whakahaere, ki ngā ture EGR/NZEM, me te whakatakoto aratohu hoki hei whakatutuki i ngā whāinga ka puta me ngā whāinga ā-mahi. Ko Haumarutanga tō ingoa tuarua, waihoki, ka tino koa tō ngākau i te arataki i ō hoa mahi kia ū ki ngā mātāpono me ngā whakahaere o te noho haumaru i tēnei whare.§ §Kāore tētahi rangi e tino rite ki te rangi o mua mai, nā te mea e ako ana koe i ngā tikanga tūtohu matua e tohitū ana ki te wharehiko ngāwhā o Wairakei, heoi anō, anei ētahi o ngā mahi hei whakatutuki māu;§ § §He whakahaere wharehiko ā-rohe, ā-whakahaere mamao hoki, mā ngā pūnaha DCS, he whakautu hoki i ngā pūohotanga / take.§ §He aroturuki i ngā mahinga o te whare, he whakaū tonu i ngā mahinga tika, he kite wawe i ngā mahi mūhore i mua i te pupūnga ake o tētahi raru.§ §He whai kia hāngai ngā kaupapa me ngā mahi ki ngā whakaaetanga ā-taiao, ki ngā aratohu me ngā tikanga ā-taiao o te kamupene.§ §He āwhina hoki ki ētahi atu wāhi, whare rānei, i ngā wā e pīrangitia ana, mā te tūtohu āheinga hei whakawhanake i ngā pūnaha me ngā tukanga, mā te tuari i ētahi whakaaro taunaki, rautaki hoki/rānei ki ētahi atu kaimahi, kia iti iho ai te tūpono atu ki ngā tūraruraru.§ § § §Ka pai hoki me he kei a koe ētahi o ēnei kura:§ § §I ahu mai koe i tētahi ao mahi ā-rehe§ §Kua whāia tētahi tohu EnChem 3, 4 rānei, te 1st Class Stationary, te 3rd Marine, tētahi e hāngai ana rānei§ § § §Ko wai koe?§ §Ki ō mātou whakaaro, koinei ngā whanonga ka puta i te tangata e whāia ana e mātou, ngā wheako, te waiaro hoki rānei ka whakatinanahia e koe.§ § § § §He Ngākau Pākiki – §ko koe tonu rā tēnā ka whiu i te pātai, “he aha ai”, i tētahi horanga kai hūhunu. Koinei te ngākau pākiki e ārahi nei i te āhua o āu mahi, o tō tīma anō hoki.§ §He Whakaaro Nui Ki Te Tangata – §he tangata whakaaro nui koe, ā, ka ora tō ngākau i te mahi tahi ki ētahi atu, he mea nui hoki ō mahi me te āhua o tō tiaki i ētahi atu ki a koe.§ §He Kanohi Arotahi – §ka arotahi koe ki ngā kaupapa whai take, kaua ki ngā kaupapa take kore.§ §He Kaikōkiri – §ka haere ngātahi tēnei me tō ngākau pākiki, nā te mea he rite tonu tō whakaaro ‘me pēhea e pai ake ai’, ko koe tētahi o te tokoiti e tau ana te noho i ngā wā o te uaua. Koia hoki rā te wā papai e ako ai te tangata!§ § § §Ka rere ngā mahi o tēnei pākihi i te ao, i te pō, nō reira, ka huri hei mahi tīpakopako kia mutu ngā whakangungu katoa§ §Ko tā Contact Energy, he whai kia haumaru, kia ngākau tapatahi hoki te āhua o te mahi, kia nui ngā whakaaro, kia kaha hoki te whakaute i ngā taera, ngā ao, ngā wheako me ngā whakaaro kanorau hoki o ētahi atu.§ §Anei, e toro nei i te ringa, e āki nei hoki i te wahine, i te tangata whenua, i te hunga i ahu mai i ētahi ao anō, kia whakakīa te puka whakauru.§ §Ka nui ake ngā mahi mā te tīma nō tātou ka whakatata atu ki ngā kaupeka makariri o te tau, nō reira, kei te hiahia kia wawe tā mātou whai i tētahi mō tēnei tūranga. Mehemea kua pānuitia tēnei e koe, ā, kua tāwheta i a mātou tō ngākau, kaua e whakaroaroa. Tono mai!§ § § §More details:§ §Application is very easy, hit the apply now to submit your CV. If you have any questions, please email the team on §talent.acquisition@contactenergy.co.nz§ §§§§Right to live and work§§You must have the§ right to live and work §in this location to apply for this job.§§§

jobText: TXT/50649685.txt	§Project Adviser - Tuvalu Biogas§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Project Adviser - Tuvalu Biogas§§Advertiser: §Volunteer Service Abroad (VSA)§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§29 Sept 2020§§Location§§Auckland§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Mining, Resources & Energy§, §Natural Resources & Water§§§§§§§§§  §    §    §      §Project Adviser - Tuvalu Biogas §      §The Organisation§The Pacific Community (SPC) is the principal scientific and technical organisation in the pacific region. An international organisation owned and governed by its 26 member states, SPC has been supporting development activities since 1947. The organisation envisions a region of peace, harmony, security, social inclusion and prosperity,  where all Pacific people can lead free, healthy and productive lives.  Covering over 20 sectors, they are  renowned for knowledge and innovation in such areas as fisheries science, public health surveillance, geoscience and conservation of plant genetic resources for food security.   §  §The Role§Working within the Geo-resources and Energy Programme (GEP), this assignment will proliferate a project providing bio-gas units to households across the 9 inhabited atolls of Tuvalu. Responsibilities will include:§1) Consulting with relevant stakeholders;§2) Developing project proposals in collaboration with SPC and the Ministry of Public Utilities and Infrastructure; and§3) Identifying relevant donors, submitting project proposals and engaging in further funding discussions.§Bio-gas can make an important contribution to the energy sector on small islands and previous recipients of domestic bio-gas units have reported significant benefits.§Why you'll love it§Based in Suva, the capital city of Fiji, the volunteer will enjoy the high quality of life this cosmopolitan city has to offer.  Suva hosts a number of international  intergovernmental organisations, good stores, markets with fresh seasonal produce and a variety of restaurants. The growing expatriate community and students from across the pacific contribute to a vibrant and diverse atmosphere. Additionally, this role will build further capacity in the GEP division of SPC to fund energy projects in remote areas. The volunteer will end each day, feeling satisfied they have contributed to making the world a better place.  §What we're looking for:§        §          §Qualifications in project management, international development, resource economics or equivalent experience;§          §Experience in developing funding proposals; and§          §An ability to engage with stakeholders§        § If you are an experienced Project Manager and ever thought about taking on a new adventure in beautiful Fiji, we'd love to hear from you.§https://vsa.org.nz/assets/Assignment-Descriptions-§2019-2020§/Project-Adviser-Tuvalu-Biogas-FIJ-41474-1-1.pdf§VSA volunteers receive a living allowance and accommodation, insurance, and medical costs are provided. jobTitle: RCO Maintainer Electrical Job in Southland - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50652867.txt	§RCO Maintainer Electrical§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§RCO Maintainer Electrical§§Advertiser: §Rio Tinto§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§29 Sept 2020§§Location§§Southland§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Mining, Resources & Energy§, §Mining - Engineering & Maintenance§§§§§§§HV Electrical Maintainer / Trainee Rectifier Control Officer§ §NZAS makes some of the purest aluminium in the world, using renewable hydro-electricity, and we are proud of the fact that NZAS is one of only a handful of smelters that can market under Rio Tinto’s RenewAl brand. This guarantees that our aluminium is made from traceable raw materials and is produced with electricity from low carbon sources, using world class smelting processes. § §The Opportunity§ §We currently have a vacancy for High Voltage Maintainer/Rectifier Control Officer (RCO) in our Power Supply team. The successful applicant will be maintaining NZAS high voltage assets to maximise equipment availability and minimise disruption to production lines.§ §Initially you will work as a HV industrial electrician undertaking regular planned maintenance and HV Switching in a high voltage switchyard.§ §Training to become an RCO will commence simultaneously while in the HV Electrical Maintainer role, as advised by your Supervisor. Therefore, we are looking for someone who is capable and willing to train as an RCO as required.§ §What you will need for this role§ §Requirements for this role include:§ § §New Zealand Electrical registration and a current practising license§ §Skills in formal fault finding, diagnosis and defect elimination techniques§ §A demonstrated ability to learn new concepts quickly§ §Flexibility to work shift work§ § §The following would be highly desirable:§ § §Field experience in High Voltage industry§ §Competency in use of SAP maintenance systems§ §Comprehensive knowledge of risk management and change recording§ §Comprehensive knowledge of maintenance strategies and tactics.§ §Experience in the application of lean manufacturing and reliability / condition monitoring techniques§ §Formal training in problem solving (e.g. Apollo Root Cause Analysis)§ § §What the role entails§ §This is a Roster 2 shift work role (2 x 12 hours days, 2 x 12 hour nights, 4 days off) with a generous shift allowance provision.§ §You will possess a personal commitment to safety and teamwork, along with a strong desire to develop your career, while contributing to the success of the operation. This is a small team in a critical area of the plant, so flexibility is also a requirement.§ §At NZAS, you will be rewarded with an attractive salary along with many other employee benefits. Working within a dynamic and friendly culture, in an organisation renowned for its world class safety standards and high quality product, this is a rare opportunity not to be missed. § §We are a company that believes in equal opportunity employment and we strongly encourage female applicants to apply.§ §The closing date for applications is Sunday 11th of October 2020.§§§§

You’re motivated by delivering exceptional support to the wider organisation and be looking to expand your horizons by working with a dynamic and growing company.§        §Us§        §Todd Energy is a subsidiary of the Todd Corporation, a New Zealand owned organisation with diverse interests and a strong reputation nationally. time effectively and demonstrate a well-organised and systematic approach.§          §Ability to manage confidential issues in a professional manner§          §Ability to quickly establish credibility across the organisation and to engage others to support the most effective and efficient supplier solution for the varied areas supported.§          §Highly developed communication skills with the ability to interact professionally with a diverse range of clients both internal and external and the ability to communicate and impart complex issues.§          §Competent analyst able to organise large data sets and provide meaningful results in terms of business outcomes, trends and constraints.§          §A propensity to learn often complex requirements and preferences of our customer divisions, supported by customer division subject matter experts.§          §Skills in database management and record keeping.§          §Proficient in Microsoft Office in particular Excel, Word and PowerPoint and skilled in computerised systems such MEX and FinanceOne and advantage.§          §Ability to manage a number of tasks concurrently and prioritise own workload§          §Customer focus and ability to meet tight deadlines§        § §To Apply§        §Please visit Seek or online at: https://www.toddenergy.co.nz/work-for-us/job-vacancies/§        § Applications close Monday 12 October 2020, 5pm§      §      §      §    §  §§§You§ §You will have broad procurement or purchasing experience in oil and gas operations or a similar industry. ensuring systems are maintained up to date, transacting purchase order activities whilst providing purchasing analysis and reporting and procurement/cost control support for shutdowns as required.§ §Suitable applicants must have:§ § § §At least 2 years broad procurement or purchasing experience, preferably with a background in the oil and gas, utility or other large infrastructure industry.§ §Demonstrated experience in: § §implementing and sourcing activities such as vendor evaluations, tender processes;§ §processes in an organisation of similar size and scope.§ § § §Ability to think ahead and plan work to meet requirements, to prioritise and mange time effectively and demonstrate a well-organised and systematic approach.§ §Ability to manage confidential issues in a professional manner§ §Ability to quickly establish credibility across the organisation and to engage others to support the most effective and efficient supplier solution for the varied areas supported.§ §Highly developed communication skills with the ability to interact professionally with a diverse range of clients both internal and external and the ability to communicate and impart complex issues.§ §Competent analyst able to organise large data sets and provide meaningful results in terms of business outcomes, trends and constraints.§ §A propensity to learn often complex requirements and preferences of our customer divisions, supported by customer division subject matter experts.§ §Skills in database management and record keeping.§ §Proficient in Microsoft Office in particular Excel, Word and PowerPoint and skilled in computerised systems such MEX and FinanceOne and advantage.§ §Ability to manage a number of tasks concurrently and prioritise own workload§ §Customer focus and ability to meet tight deadlines§ § §To Apply§ §Please visit Seek or online at: https://www.toddenergy.co.nz/work-for-us/job-vacancies/§ § Applications close Monday 12 October 2020, 5pm§§§§

jobTitle: Plant Operator - Power Generation Job in Auckland - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50661107.txt	§Plant Operator - Power Generation§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Plant Operator - Power Generation§§Advertiser: §Alinta Energy§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§30 Sept 2020§§Location§§Auckland§, §Papakura & Franklin§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Mining, Resources & Energy§, §Power Generation & Distribution§§§§§§§Varied role in the power generation industry with full training provided§§Glenbrook, South Auckland location§§Structured and supportive learning environment§§With an owned and contracted generation portfolio of around 3,000MW, Alinta Energy delivers an essential service to over one million combined electricity and gas retail customers in Australia. We employ around 700 people throughout operations across five of Australia’s six states as well as New Zealand. With a decades-long history in Australia as an energy generator and retailer, we’re proud to deliver for our customers. §§We’re determined to make energy more affordable and we are committed to securing an energy mix that delivers on this challenge. This includes working to deliver 1,500MW of large-scale renewable energy by 2025 as well as delivering innovative and lower-emissions energy solutions for major industrial customers.§An exciting opportunity has arisen within Alinta Energy's Glenbrook Power Station. The Station utilises the waste gases from New Zealand Steel's Ironmaking process at Glenbrook to generate steam and drive our steam turbines, offering a fantastic opportunity to learn how to operate diverse plant and equipment.§We are looking for a positive, enthusiastic and motivated individual who is looking to develop or continue their career in the Power Generation industry.§A full training program and induction will be in place, which will cover:§§How the Iron making process integrates with the Co-generation Plants§Steam turbine and boiler operations§Plant monitoring and responding to process changes§Controlling boiler and cooling water chemistry§Report, troubleshoot and carryout fault finding and investigations§§To be successful you will be:§§Reliable and motivated to work as part of a shift team covering 24/7 plant operation§Have a strong technical aptitude – a trade or power station experience will be highly considered§Self-motivated and eager to achieve qualifications in Boiler and Turbine Operations§Previous experience in the Power Generation (or similar) would be highly regarded§Able to perform well as part of an effective team under pressure§Good with people – a positive and enthusiastic personality is a must§A NZ Resident with good verbal and written communication skills§§An attractive salary package is offered along with a comprehensive training program, assistance to obtain further qualifications and opportunities for career progression. Alinta Energy is an Equal Opportunity employer and we encourage all applications regardless of gender or background.§Let’s spread the positive energy together…§Click “APPLY” to submit your application. Closing Date: 13th October 2020.§§§§Right to live and work§§You must have the§ right to live and work §in this location to apply for this job.§§§

jobTitle: Contact Energy Māori Summer Internships 2020 Job in Waikato - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50665325.txt	§Contact Energy Māori Summer Internships 2020§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Contact Energy Māori Summer Internships 2020§§Advertiser: §Contact Energy§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§1 Oct 2020§§Location§§Waikato§, §Taupo§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Mining, Resources & Energy§, §Health, Safety & Environment§§§§§§§§§  §    §    §      §Contact Energy Māori Summer Internships 2020 §      §        §E te iwi, Contact’s annual summer internships for Māori are now open for applications! To be eligible for our internships you must whakapapa to Ngāti Tahu, or Tauhara or Wairākei hapū of Ngāti Tūwharetoa. §        § §        §Te Whiwhinga mahi §        §Our internships are aimed at developing whānau, hapū, iwi and Māori capacity, while supporting Contact in its endeavour to build stronger relationships with tangata whenua, particularly within the regions where we operate.  All interns will be based in Taupō or Wellington. §        § §        §As an electricity generator and retailer, Contact offers an opportunity to get hands on experience - from working at a geothermal power station in Taupō through to experiencing corporate life in Wellington.  §        § §        §Ko wai koe §        §We welcome applications from a wide range of people, whether you are in study or not. We’re looking for dynamic and confident Māori who want to gain experience working in a corporate environment who:  §        §          §            §Have a strong work ethic and commitment to kaupapa.  §          §          §            §Are passionate about, and have experience in any of a wide range of disciplines, including engineering, resource/environmental management, science, Maori/community development, technology, finance, law or others.  §          §          §            §Are looking to make a contribution to their whānau, kāinga, marae, hapū or iwi. §          §        §        §          §            §Are excellent communicators and are comfortable speaking to a broad range of audiences. §          §          §            §Have an understanding of te reo Māori me ōna tikanga. §          §          §            §Possesses research skills and familiarity with Microsoft Office applications.  §          §          §            §Have strong whakaaro and views and are not afraid to share them with us. §          §        §        § §        §How to apply §        §In the spirit of this new digital world, we are asking all applicants to complete an online one- way video that will cover off the fundamentals of what we are looking for in this year's Māori Interns.  Don’t worry it won't take you too long – we reckon 15 minutes should do the trick! §        § §        §Click on the §‘Apply for this job’ l§ink below to be transported to our one-way video platform. §        § §        §Additional documents §        §After you have submitted your application we will contact you to request confirmation of your whakapapa OR a letter of endorsement from your hapū/iwi representative, or kaumātua for any of the following:  §        §Ngāti Tahu internship open to uri o Ngāti Tahu. §        §Tauhara internship open to those of Tūwharetoa descent who whakapapa to Tauhara hapū. §        §Wairākei internship open to those of Tūwharetoa descent who whakapapa to Wairākei hapū. §        § §        §Note:§ If you’re application is successful, you’ll need to complete a pre-employment form covering your eligibility to work in New Zealand and your work availability, contact details for two references, health/medical requirements and a security check. §        § §      §      §      §    §    §contact.co.nz§  §§§E te iwi, Contact’s annual summer jobText: TXT/50670077.txt	§Geothermal Operations Technician§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Geothermal Operations Technician§§Advertiser: §Ngati Tuwharetoa Holdings Ltd§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§1 Oct 2020§§Location§§Bay of Plenty§, §Rest of Bay of Plenty§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Mining, Resources & Energy§, §Oil & Gas - Operations§§§§§§Ngati Tuwharetoa Geothermal Assets Ltd is a Kawerau based Iwi owned business that provides geothermal energy to a number of clients for the purpose of electricity generation, pulp and paper processing, milk processing, and timber drying. Ngati Tuwharetoa Geothermal Assets Ltd is a leading company in the provision of decarbonised energy solutions from a sustainable resource. Our continued growth is enabling New Zealand industry to play its part in a more sustainable future. Are you ready to join a company going places?§ §We are seeking to employ a suitably skilled individual to join our close-knit team operating and maintaining our assets that supply our valued customers§ §The Purpose§ §The position will contribute to provide a full asset operation and management function to efficiently run and maintain the steam field and support infrastructure. As this is a 24/7 operation there will be a requirement to be on a roster that will involve call out requirements outside of normal working hours.§ §The Person§ §You will be able to demonstrate the successful planning and preparation of work scopes, permitting, and supervision of maintenance activities carried out by contractors. Further to this the ability to undertake a degree of hands on work will be essential at specific times.§ §Operation of the plant is undertaken by the team and again is hands on ensuring all safe operating practices are met and that the supply to the end users is optimised.§ §To be a serious candidate you will bring:§ § §Sound experience and proven history in heavy industry§ §Relevant tertiary or trade based qualifications that may include ENCHEM L4§ §Previous geothermal power generation experience is advantageous but not essential§ §Strong written and oral communication skills§ §Demonstrated ability to supervise and manage HS&E, compliance and quality elements§ §An aptitude and problem-solving§ §Project management experience§ §Comprehensive IT and reporting skills§ §Knowledge and experience with MMS (preferably Maximo)§ §A hands on proactive attitude§ §An ability to understand complex process logic§ §True desire and dedication to work with, and contribute to, a close knit supportive team is essential§ §Hold a full valid NZ drivers licence and be eligible to work in New Zealand without sponsorship§ §In Return§ §We offer a competitive remuneration package relative to the skills, knowledge and experience you have to contribute. All within a family friendly challenging work environment that will enable development of yourself professionally and personally.§§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in New Zealand?§How many years of project management experience do you have?§Do you have a current New Zealand driver's licence?§Are you willing to undergo a pre-employment medical check?§Are you willing to undergo pre-employment drug and alcohol screening?§§§

jobTitle: Process Safety Lead Job in Auckland - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50670144.txt	§Process Safety Lead§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Process Safety Lead§§Advertiser: §Watercare Services Limited§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§1 Oct 2020§§Location§§Auckland§, §Auckland Central§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Mining, Resources & Energy§, §Oil & Gas - Engineering & Maintenance§§§§§§Reporting to the Head of Operations Excellence and based centrally in Newmarket, we have an exciting opportunity for someone to really step up to lead, establish and manage process safety approaches, systems, and business processes across our business.§As the Process Safety Lead, you will provide subject matter expertise to our operational teams, other water industry practitioners and our external partners where appropriate, setting the benchmark for excellence in this area amongst our peers. You will develop and implement process safety principles and systems so that our assets are operated to world class and best practice standards. You will work across our progressive business to ensure the health, safety and wellbeing of our staff, customers, communities and others who interact with our assets. Other key functions of our Process Safety Lead include:§Provide direction, technical assistance, and process safety leadership§Support operational teams to drive the implementation of process safety principles to positively impact business performance and outcomes§Provide our customers with the assurance and knowledge that Watercare is focused on the safe and reliable operation of its assets and engagement with communities during asset development§Working in a world-class and industry leading water services organisation with internationally recognised industry§You will be dedicated to a high work standard, be flexible, and able to think "Out of the Box" with a can-do attitude. You will also be an excellent communicator with both internal and external stakeholders. The following skills and attributes are required:§Equivalent to a tertiary degree in engineering or related field§Minimum 10 years' experience in process safety, engineering, and its management§Excellent verbal and written communication abilities§Proven ability to lead business and technology change programs§Experience in management of teams of technical experts, providing support in a collaborative environment§You will be a solution provider§Ability to establish and grow strong relationships with a variety of water industry practitioners, stakeholders and the community at large§Develop strategies and deliver outcomes§In working for Watercare, you will be joining a diverse, professional team where continual training and professional development is available. As the successful candidate, you will be part of an organisation with a commitment to its staff, customers and our communities with a commitment to the sustainable management of our natural resources.§Watercare offers a competitive salary and a staff benefits package including:§Training and development opportunities§Life and income protection insurance plans§Discounted banking packages§Employee discounts at a range of large retailers.§If you are looking for an exciting career opportunity with lots of potential for development then apply now through our careers website www.careers.watercare.co.nz.§The successful applicant must be able to pass a pre-employment drug test and medical. You must also be legally entitled to work long-term in New Zealand.§§§§Right to live and work§§You must have the§ right to live and work §in this location to apply for this job.§§§

You’ll also assist with work plans and ensure that relevant field paperwork is completed as necessary. §What we’re offering§- An interesting role within a great team§- The chance to work with a company who puts our people at the heart of the organisation and is committed to safety §- A company who puts our people at the heart of the organisation and is committed to safety leadership at all levels§- Competitive remuneration, an in-house wellbeing programme and initiatives including group discounted medical insurance, discounted gym membership§Who we’re looking for§We’re looking for an experienced Transmission Line Mechanic with up to date registration and competencies, who has at least a Class 2 drivers license.§You will need to demonstrate the following:§- Proven experience in Transmission work environments§- Great verbal and written communication skills§- A strong commitment to health and safety§- A great attitude and a willingness to be part of a team§Get in touch!§We’d love to hear from team players who fit the above and have a great ‘can do’ attitude. §Due to current border restrictions, unfortunately applications from international candidates or those without the right to work in New Zealand cannot be considered. §Northpower has an in-house recruitment team who manage recruitment for all our vacancies.  If you're interested in a role with us we would encourage you to apply directly online to us, as we don't accept candidates via agency (unless the role is advertised by the agency at our request).§§§§Right to live and work§§You must have the§ right to live and work §in this location to apply for this job.§§§

jobTitle: Systems Technician - Hydro Job in Otago - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50672799.txt	§Systems Technician - Hydro§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Systems Technician - Hydro§§Advertiser: §Contact Energy§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§2 Oct 2020§§Location§§Otago§, §Rest of Otago§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Mining, Resources & Energy§, §Power Generation & Distribution§§§§§§§§§  §    §    §      §Systems Technician - Hydro §      §        §More than half a million Kiwis count on us to keep the lights on, the hot water running, and the central heating fired up. It’s an important job and right now we need highly skilled Hydro Systems Technician to help us put energy where it matters. We are deeply committed to ensuring that we leave mother earth in a better state than we picked it up. To help us achieve this, our Hydro team has never been more important! §        §Why is this role important? §        §Our team of Hydro System Technicians provide operational technical support and management of technical systems and processes for the team. We take our work and safety seriously and equally enjoy a bit of fun together too.  §        § §        §What will you be doing? §        §Based in Central Otago district you will be responsible for maintaining and improving our plant capability, reliability and efficiency. How will you achieve this? Great question. You will work in a team and alongside our contractors to help oversee electrical, instrumentation and control and protection systems on our Hydro stations. You will take immense pride in developing a deep understanding of plant operational systems so you can provide technical response and advise. You will perform maintenance, testing and project work on everything from control systems to generators to spill gates and everything in between.   §        §How will you be successful? §        §This role is not for the faint hearted. Above all you will be able to demonstrate technical competencies (we have listed important ones below)  §        §          §            §National Diploma/NZCE Electrical, Trade Certification or equivalent electrical experience §          §          §            §Experience in power systems and electrical protection and testing §          §          §            §Knowledge of powerplant electrical systems such as HV switchgear, transformers, generators, electrical protection, and electrical distribution systems. §          §          §            §Demonstrated ability to build and maintain relationships with key stakeholders, including strengths in influencing, conflict management, and negotiation §          §        §        § §        §We are in a privileged position to provide an essential service to Kiwis, this type of opportunity in one of the most beautiful places in NZ does not come up very often. If you think you have what it takes don’t delay – apply now!  §        § §        §§      §      §      §    §    §contact.co.nz§  §§§More than half a million Kiwis count on us to keep the lights on, the hot water running, and the central heating fired up. You will perform maintenance, testing and project work on everything from control systems to generators to spill gates and everything in between.   § §How will you be successful? § §This role is not for the faint hearted. Above all you will be able to demonstrate technical competencies (we have listed important ones below)  § § § §National Diploma/NZCE Electrical, Trade Certification or equivalent electrical experience § § § §Experience in power systems and electrical protection and testing § § § §Knowledge of powerplant electrical systems such as HV switchgear, transformers, generators, electrical protection, and electrical distribution systems. § § § §Demonstrated ability to build and maintain relationships with key stakeholders, including strengths in influencing, conflict management, and negotiation § § § § §We are in a privileged position to provide an essential service to Kiwis, this type of opportunity in one of the most beautiful places in NZ does not come up very often. Supported by the Design & Engineering Team in Christchurch with the autonomy of a regional depot, this role brings the best of both worlds.§With a head office in Christchurch and our regional depots in Cromwell and Tawa, Wellington, Connetics are responsible for constructing and maintaining overhead and underground lines and equipment across these locations.§You'll bring:§Technical understanding of electricity distribution networks, including design in overhead lines, 11kV/400V substations, underground reticulations, substation and protection systems§Proven NZ distribution design experience§Electrical engineering qualification (desired)§Contract negotiation skills§Excellent written and verbal communication and customer service skills§The ability to work well in a team§A familiarity with AutoCAD.§This role requires a dynamic, customer focussed person who works well in the team from end to end process. You'll work from concept design through to completion, taking in client liaison and design so you'll be a practical, customer-focussed person who can get on site and understand the balance between design and constructability.§So this could be the advancement you're looking for in your career. You'll also find a great range of staff benefits, including long service leave, wellbeing benefits, and an employer that understands you have a life outside work. jobText: TXT/50677053.txt	§Qualified Cable Jointer§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Qualified Cable Jointer§§Advertiser: §Electra§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§2 Oct 2020§§Location§§Wellington§, §Porirua & Kapiti Coast§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Mining, Resources & Energy§, §Power Generation & Distribution§§§§§§We are Electra Limited, a dynamic, forward-thinking, and innovative local business, part of a vibrant community in the Horowhenua and Kapiti regions of New Zealand. We’ve been servicing our customers and the community for more than 90 years and believe the key to our success is our people, the community support we receive, our product innovation and diversification into new industries. The Electra Group consists of Electra Ltd, Electra Generation, and Electra Services (trading as Securely). § §Electra is committed to living our values of Safety, Respect, Professional, Accountability and Integrity. We continually strive for excellence in everything that we do.  § §We are on the hunt for a Cable Jointer to join us, based at our depot in Paraparaumu on a permanent, full-time basis.§ § You are fully qualified with substantial experience in your trade, as you undertake:§ § §The joining and terminating of low voltage and high voltage cables up to 33KV, including managing shutdowns for both§ §Installing and maintaining electrical power distribution equipment§ §Utilising your knowledge and experience to plan jobs, to ensure generation requirements are implemented as required§ §Carrying out of network routine inspections, fault finding and service/repairs on overhead installations, underground cables and testing of instruments.§ §Undertaking substation, transformers and switchgear maintenance, repairs, and installations§ §You have great communication skills, are able to talk to people from different areas of a project to ensure continuity and that deadlines are met, and are able to solve problems, all whilst performing your job to a high standard, with an excellent health and safety record.§ §Whats on offer?§ §We offer a competitive hourly rate, a generous well-being package plus career and professional development, investment in training and your safety, plus a great bunch of people to work with.  What more could you want?§ § §§§§

jobTitle: Energy Analyst Job in Auckland - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50679917.txt	§Energy Analyst§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Energy Analyst§§Advertiser: §Genesis§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§4 Oct 2020§§Location§§Auckland§, §Auckland Central§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Mining, Resources & Energy§, §Analysis & Reporting§§§§§§Genesis is New Zealand's largest energy retailer, supplying electricity, natural gas and LPG, whilst generating around 20% of New Zealand's electricity, across our portfolio of thermal and renewable generation sites across the country. The spread of locations and fuel types in the portfolio gives us significant operating flexibility, whilst we aim to generate and contract electricity at the lowest cost to the Company to meet our customer demand.§About the role:§We've got a fantastic opportunity for two Energy Analysts to join us. As part of our Wholesale Markets team you'll be joining a fascinating, complex part of our business that manages our electricity portfolio and carbon obligations.§Key responsibilities:§Undertake analysis to help optimise the Genesis Energy generation, fuel utilisation, and sale mix.§Develop and maintain models to ensure that they provide accurate, consistent, and timely analysis. Ensure Genesis has current and robust information available to support its analysis and decision-making.§Use models effectively to depict simplified views of complexity and uncertainty. Use results, trends, and insights to inform and support decision-making across Wholesale Markets and the wider business.§Identify, manage, and monitor market risks, including keeping abreast of industry developments and regulatory change.§Work with, explore, and manipulate large datasets to understand energy market behaviour.§About you:§Circa 4-6 years analytical experience, ideally within the energy sector.§A degree qualification in a quantitative discipline e.g. mathematics/statistics/engineering/finance/IT.§A commercial and business oriented mindset.§Proven track record of experience and achievement in a quantitative financial and commercial and/or analytical role, using complex information.§Extensive experience working with and a high degree of comfort with large datasets.§Skills in one or more of the following: vSPD, SQL, VBA, PowerBI, Phyton, R coding, transmission modelling.§Demonstrated ability to analyse and interpret complex problems and use critical thinking in developing a range of options/solutions.§We are looking for someone with a career to date that demonstrates progressive increases in responsibility for analysis that goes well beyond standard reporting requirements. An inquisitive nature and ability to communicate and lead commercial conversations and your investigative approach will ensure that you add value.§Excitingly, Genesis and the wider industry is evolving rapidly and the ability to deliver a reliant and resilient energy system will bring significant changes. If you're looking for an opportunity to join a business that offers progression, development and strong leadership then apply now!§Our culture:§Genesis is proud to be an inclusive workplace; we celebrate difference and diversity and aim to empower our employees. We're a business built on innovation and optimism; a place where we value our people and provide opportunities for them to build outstanding careers and a better New Zealand.§Create your world of tomorrow, at Genesis.§§§§Right to live and work§§You must have the§ right to live and work §in this location to apply for this job.§§§

jobText: TXT/50681527.txt	§Manager Network Development§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Manager Network Development§§Advertiser: §EQI Global§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§5 Oct 2020§§Location§§Waikato§, §Rest of Waikato§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Mining, Resources & Energy§, §Power Generation & Distribution§§§§§§ §Leadership - motivated to make a difference§ §Accomplished leader of performance and innovation§ §Lifestyle choices§ §The Lines Company is proud to keep over 18,500 customers connected to electricity throughout the King Country, Ruapehu and Central Plateau. They supply both residential and major industrial businesses from their Head Office in Te Kūiti. The business and its subsidiaries have in excess of 160 staff working across the region with the aim to ensure safe and efficient operation and long term stewardship of the network. 100% owned by the Waitomo Energy Services Customer Trust, The Lines Company has a focus on innovation and use of technology to ensure effective operation of the network and its sustainability for future generations.§  §The purpose of this newly created role of Manager Network Development is to continue to build on the positive changes made over the past three years through further improving our asset management processes, implementing new technology, and enabling and developing people, all whilst placing our customers at the heart of everything we do.§  §The Manager Network Development will lead a team tasked with the long term strategic management of network assets through smart information analysis and planning, assessing risk, technical innovation, compliance, and planning for maintenance and capital spend. The network assets include the planning for the efficient operation of small scale hydro generation. The network is complex and covers an extensive land area with a diverse range of geographic and climatic challenges. Consequently, the role is diverse with many interesting challenges and opportunities to apply new thinking, develop smart technical solutions and deliver pragmatic outcomes.§  §Applicants will demonstrate the following attributes:§ § §A champion of exemplary health and safety behaviours§ §Proven ability to provide motivational and inclusive leadership§ §Initiative and a creative approach to problem solving with a proactive 'can do' attitude§ §Relevant progressive asset management experiences.§ §Proven ability to lead teams and build effective relationships with all stakeholders§ §Demonstrated ability to work at both a strategic and operational level§ §A relevant tertiary qualification is desirable§ §The company office is in Te Kūiti and the appointee can live in the surrounding Waikato or King Country regions. The lifestyle choices for family and adventure are extensive.§  §For further information on The Lines Company, please visit their website; www.thelinescompany.co.nz§  §Confidential enquiries can be made to Graham Ewing or Lynell Bell of EQI Global on §+64 3 377 7793§ or email at §search@eqiglobal.com§. A position description can be viewed and downloaded at www.eqiglobal.com.§  §Applications for the role close on Friday, 30 October 2020. All applications will be acknowledged via email.§§§§

jobTitle: Control Room Team Leader Job in Manawatu - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50689320.txt	§Control Room Team Leader§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Control Room Team Leader§§Advertiser: §Electra§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§6 Oct 2020§§Location§§Manawatu§, §Palmerston North§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Mining, Resources & Energy§, §Power Generation & Distribution§§§§§§We are Electra Limited, a dynamic, forward-thinking and innovative local company, part of a vibrant community in the Horowhenua and Kapiti regions of New Zealand. We have been servicing our customers and the community for more than 90 years. We believe the key to our success is our people, the community support we receive, our product innovation and diversification into new industries. The Electra Group consists of Electra Ltd, Electra Generation, and Electra Services (trading as Securely). § §Electra is committed to living our values of Safety, Respect, Professional, Accountability and Integrity. We continually strive for excellence in everything that we do.  § §In this newly created role, you will be a hands-on leader, managing our Control Room Operators.   Your key focus is to ensure the continued safe and reliable delivery of electricity to our customers across the Horowhenua and Kapiti regions of NZ.§ §You are analytical by nature and have an inquisitive mind; you enjoy reading and interpreting reliability data and monitoring network performance to continuously improve reliability, systems and processes.§ §With ideally 5+ years of experience, you are an Electrical Engineer with a Tertiary Qualification, or time served on the tools in the industry, you understand the intricacies of how Control Rooms work and operate, across the network. You remain calm under pressure and can supply reliable and timely information to key stakeholders when significant outages or emergencies occur.§ §As this role is very process-driven, details focused and regulated, we would  foresee the successful applicant joining us from the Electricity Distribution sector, however other industries we’d love to hear from people from include: Aviation, Gas,Oil or other Utilities. § §Anyone from these industries understands that when things go wrong, supply becomes unavailable or safety is called into question, disastrous outcomes can occur, and as this person, you’ve made it your job to never let these things happen, under your control! § §No matter which area you come from, you’re hungry to impart knowledge, a stickler for the process and rules, you understand why they are in place, you’re a teacher, a mentor and a coach but similarly you have high expectations and will not let shortcuts be taken.  You still love getting your hands dirty and learning, everyday  You thrive in pressured, and sometimes stressful situations, and solving problems to keep our customers power on is just part of your ethos.§ § §What do we offer you?§ §This role has a competitive salary commensurate to skills and expertise, a generous well-being package plus career and professional development, investment in training and your safety, plus a great bunch of people to work with.  What more could you want?§§§§

jobTitle: Asset Supervisor Job in Manawatu - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50695726.txt	§Asset Supervisor§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Asset Supervisor§§Advertiser: §Pioneer Energy§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§7 Oct 2020§§Location§§Manawatu§, §Rest of Manawatu§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Mining, Resources & Energy§, §Other§§§§§§Asset Supervisor, Energy Facility – Ohakune§  §(Full time permanent)§  §To Apply§ §  §Click the link to our Applicant Tracking Systems below or add to your browser:§  §https://pioneergen.bamboohr.com/jobs/view.php?id=39§  § §  §An opportunity for an experienced industrial plant supervisor has become available. We’re looking for an organised, team player to join our company.§  §The position is located onsite at the Winstone Pulp International mill, Ohakune. (WPI Karioi) §  §About Us§  §Pioneer Energy works across an array of energy assets and locations, from Hydro and Wind to Thermal and Gas. We have people, plant and assets in locations from Auckland to Bluff.§  §The head office in Alexandra, Central Otago.  We are owned by a charitable trust, The Central Lakes Trust and have a long successful history in the energy industry.§  §While our experience has been 92 years in the making and our senior team is amazing, it’s the fresh talent we’re nurturing, the innovative thinking we’re developing and we are proud of our culture to support, train and develop our people. §  §Pioneer Energy has a comprehensive employee wellness and benefit programme which includes (but is not limited to) Employee Wellness Grants, Employee Assistance Programmes, flexible working hours, Health Life and Trauma Insurance, Flu Vaccinations and community volunteering releases.  See more visit our website: www.pioneerenergy.co.nz.§  §The Job§  §The WPI Energy Facility is located at WPI’s Karioi site near Ohakune. The heat plant provides heat for the drying of thermo-mechanical pulp and disposes of pulp sludge from the sites waste-water treatment plant plus other wood waste bi-products.  WPI staff monitor and operate the heat plant on a 24/7 basis.§  §The role is permanent full time – 40 hours per week (Mon to Friday).§  §As part of the Pioneer team, you will be expected to deliver practical and technical expertise, working closely with WPI management and staff, supervising and overseeing heat plant operations, maintenance and management. §  §You will have experience in dealing with and supervising external suppliers and contractors. §  §The role will require you to work closely with heat plant operators providing the required assistance to ensure maximum plant reliability and availability. The ability to solve problems and recognise opportunities for process improvements will be an advantage. §  §Some hands-on work will be required and we will provide you with that specialised training.§  §Working closely with your Regional Manager, you will contribute to budget development and monitoring, assist with data logging, monthly reporting and administrating the Maintenance Management System (MEX). §  §With a good understanding of health, safety and compliance you will ensure that all work being undertaken for Pioneer Energy onsite is carried out in a safe manner and fully complies with Pioneer Energy’s and WPI’s Health and Safety Policies.§  §About you§  §We are interested in hearing from you if you have:§ § §5 years+ experience working in the industrial environment.§ §A mechanical or electrical trades background would be an advantage.§ §Experience with boilers and or thermal energy plants would also be an advantage.§ §Willing to learn and develop§ §An organised team player§ §Maintenance and small project planning skills§ §Have some experience and understanding of budgets§ §Capable of writing monthly reports§ §Have experience with a Computerised Maintenance Management System§ §Health and safety are paramount in your thinking§ §You can use a PC, familiar with Microsoft programs and communication software§ §Are physically fit and active§ §Agree to a pre-employment drug & alcohol test§ §Have a current valid driver’s licence§ §Be legally able to work in NZ now.§ §To Apply§ §  §Click the link to our Applicant Tracking Systems below or add to your browser:§  §https://pioneergen.bamboohr.com/jobs/view.php?id=39§ §Please apply by 5pm Monday 19th October 2020.§  §Email §HR@pioneerenergy.co.nz§ for a full position description§  § §§§§

jobTitle: Commercial Analyst Job in Wellington - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50709228.txt	§Commercial Analyst§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Commercial Analyst§§Advertiser: §First Gas & Rock Gas§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§8 Oct 2020§§Location§§Wellington§, §Wellington Central§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Mining, Resources & Energy§, §Other§§§§§§Working for Us:§  §We own and operate New Zealand’s high-pressure gas transmission system, which transports natural gas from Taranaki to industrial consumers throughout the North Island and spans more than 2,200 kilometres.  We also own gas distribution networks that supply more than 60,000 North Island businesses and homes as well as the Ahuroa gas storage facility and Rockgas – a national LPG supplier.   Our assets provide essential and strategically important infrastructure that supports the New Zealand economy, and we are committed to ensuring that our customers obtain maximum value from using our gas assets. §  §We are committed to creating a diverse workforce that reflects our society and a culture where people can bring their whole and best selves to work.  Our aim is to foster an inclusive culture which supports innovation by encouraging diversity of thought to come up with new ideas, make better decisions and ultimately become a more successful business§  §What you will do:§  §You will provide in-depth commercial analysis, reporting and management of billing processes within the Distribution Commercial team, which is responsible for the commercial arrangements relating to the gas distribution network.  Key responsibilities of your role will include:§ § §providing analytical support to the Distribution Commercial Manager in contractual arrangements, revenue assurance, risk management and reporting.§ §Providing commercial analysis of distribution customers, risks, investments, pricing, market and revenue.§ §Identifying opportunities and providing the analysis and insights to support the Commercial and Regulatory business strategy and the growth of the business.§ § §  §What will set you apart from the rest:§  §You will be a dynamic, self-motivated individual who enjoys working in a high performing culture. We are also looking for:§ § §A relevant tertiary qualification in commerce, finance, economics and/or law§ §Proven experience in an analytical or commercial position§ §Excellent data quality, interpretation, analytical and problem solving skills§ §High level of computer and software literacy, in particular advanced Excel/BI§ §Excellent relationship and stakeholder management skills§ §What sets us apart from the rest:§ § §Competitive remuneration and benefits§ §Personal and career development§ §Work in a challenging environment within a supportive and passionate team§ §We are committed to creating a rewarding workplace for our employees by encouraging personal development, recognising good performance, valuing teamwork and fostering equal opportunities. If this sounds like a business you want to contribute to and grow your career with, please apply online now.§  §Let’s go:§  §If this sounds like a business you want to contribute to and grow your career with, apply online with your cover letter and CV.§  §Applications close 30 October 2020§§§§
